Mrs. Ol H. is 27 years old and she is married with two children, one of whom is a student in the local school and the other is too young to study or work. Mrs. Ol H. and her husband, Mr. Pen Keo, are farmers who own a 1.9-hectare field to cultivate rice on to earn the family's living. This family lives in Tuol Kandal village in Takeo province.

In order to support the field, Mrs. Ol H. needs 2,000,000 Riel from AMK to buy a pump; the rest of the loan she will use to dig a well to support the field. Aside from farming, she is a grocer and her husband is a laborer, who can earn only a small income to support the family. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: To buy a pump

loans.name: Shameness Group

texts.en: Kumba S., who is on the right of the photo, is the leader of this group of local entrepreneurs who named their group Shameness, a Krio word. They have come to SMT/Kiva lenders for the first time to seek a loan of SLL 500,000 for each person for the purpose of expanding their businesses. Fifty-six-year-old Kumba has been selling pepper, onions and palm-oil (the most popular cooking oil) for 2 years now. Kumba was born in Kabala town, in northern Sierra Leone. She is married to a soldier and they have 3 children – all of whom are attending primary schools. Kumba wants this loan in order to expand her business by buying pepper, onions, and palm-oil in large quantities.

loans.use: To buy pepper, onions, and palm-oil in large quantities to sell.

loans.name: Sadig

texts.en: Sadig S. was born in 1982. He is married and has two children. Sadig and his family live in Baku city. He has been in this business for two years. Now this young man needs a loan of 2000 AZN to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Oke

texts.en: Oke sells women's clothes at the Ughelli market. She hopes to own a classic women's boutique in the future. She is requesting a loan of 50,000 NGN to purchase more women's clothes to sell. She is 34 years old and married with three children. Her husband is a carpenter. She has a good relationship with LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization). LAPO is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Ramzan's Group

texts.en:
R. is a wife of M. A. and they both live in a city named Vehari in Pakistan. They have a three room house in which they have lived with their family for the past 20 years. R. has given birth to five children: three sons and two daughter. All of them are enrolled in a school and are getting an education. R. and her husband are very hard working people. They run their own grocery shop in the community. They have divided their duties, so R. does her duty in the morning and M. A. does his duty in the grocery shop in the evening. 

They both work hard to increase their income and to give a better future to their kids. R. is requesting a loan to buy items (lentils, cooking oil and beverages) to diversify their grocery shop into a grocery store.

loans.use: To purchase goods for grocery shop.

loans.name: Nakyanakumbi F Namutebi Aisha Group

texts.en: N. Aisha is a hardworking business lady of twenty-nine years old, married with two children in schooling. She has a cloth business of which she has been operating for over four years. She is using the loan to purchase cloth for sale. She is an encouraging business lady whose future hope is to have a good standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase cloth to resell

loans.name: Nilsa Del Socorro

texts.es:
Desde el año 2004 por iniciativa propia Nilsa Y. C.,  inició su negocio con  la ayuda de su esposo y el objetivo de incrementar los ingresos del hogar, porque siempre ha pensado en la educación de sus tres hijos menores de edad, y en construir para ellos un  mejor futuro.

Con su negocio ha afianzado sus potencialidades emprendedores, su carácter independiente y todo esto acompañado con el hecho de participar en proceso formativos empresariales,  la han llevado a fortalecer su desempeño organizacional en la microempresa de mercancías en punto de venta, que es de su propiedada, donde comercializa papelería en general, calzado, vestuario para damas accesorio, juguetería. Nilsa quiere fortalecer la oferta de sus servicios y para este propósito está aplicando a su cuarto crédito, ella requiere un monto de $1.300.000 que invertirá en la compra de artículos de miscelánea como accesorios femeninos, collares, aretes, cintas,  cartulinas y útiles escolares.

Nilsa sueña con el crecimiento de su negocio, por eso siempre está invirtiendo en él y buscando nuevos clientes, para   poder ofrecerle a sus hijos mejores niveles educativos; ella vive muy satisfecha en el barrio Galán de Barranquilla  y resalta de este sector  un alto nivel de civismo, solidaridad y trabajo en equipo, que han permitido la convivencia pacifica y la realización de actividades donde todos sus moradores  ponen y el estado también, para mejorar el entorno como ocurrió con la pavimentación de sus calles.
texts.en:
In order to help her husband increase household income and always thinking of her three children’s education and in building a better future, Nilsa Y. C. started her business in 2004. Her business has solidified her enterprising potential, her independent character and all of this has gone hand in hand with business training that has made it possible for her to strengthen the organizational development of her micro enterprise consisting of assorted merchandise sales. She offers a variety of stationery supplies, shoes, women’s clothing and accessories and toys. Nilsa wants to strengthen her offer even more so is asking for her 4th loan valued at $1.300.000 that she will use to buy assorted merchandise like: women’s accessories, necklaces, earrings, belts, and construction paper and school supplies. Nilsa dreams with her business’ growth so she is always investing in it and looking for new customers so that she can offer her children advanced educational levels. She lives very contentedly in Barranquilla’s Galán neighborhood, an area that stands out due to its high level of civic pride, solidarity and teamwork that have made possible a peaceful coexistence and the neighborhood’s ability to reach common neighborhood improvement goals with help from the State like it was with the paving of the streets.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted merchandise like: women's accessories, necklaces, earrings, belts, construction paper and school supplies.

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Née en 1980 à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin, A. S. Julienne est mariée à TOFFA Achille, un peintre. Le couple a trois enfants, dont deux sont scolarisés. Tous les enfants vivent ensemble avec leurs parents au quartier Agbalilamè, dans la commune de Sèmè-Podji. Il y a plus de neuf ans que Julienne vit dans ce quartier avec sa famille. Julienne vient en aide à son mari et assure avec lui les charges familiales, grâce au revenu que lui apporte son activité. Julienne vend en effet de l’huile végétale à son domicile, mais aussi de façon ambulante. De façon secondaire, Julienne vend également des cartes de recharges téléphoniques. Julienne a deux ans d’expérience dans ce domaine et a déjà bénéficié de crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu’elle a bien remboursé. Julienne sollicite à nouveau un prêt, afin d’augmenter le stock de ses produits et d’accroître sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Julienne A. S. was born in 1980 in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She is married to Achille Toffa, a painter. The couple has three children two of them attend school. All the children live together with their parents in the neighborhood of Agbalilamè, in the town of Sèmè-Podji. Julienne and her family have lived in this neighborhood for over nine years. She helps her husband and, with him, provides for the family’s expenses thanks to the income brought by her activity. She sells vegetable oil from her home but also door-to-door. As a secondary activity, she also sells prepaid cards for mobile phone. She has two years of experience in this sector and has already received a loan from ALIDé. This loan was reimbursed fully. Julienne is requesting a new loan in order to increase her stock and her customer base.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of drums of vegetable oil

loans.name: Diarry

texts.fr: Diarry K. est une femme de 51 ans; elle est veuve et mère de 05 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de KOUNK. V.W. depuis le 12 septembre 2005 elle a une expérience de 3 ans et demi et a 7 fois de suite bénéficié de crédit et n'a jamais eu de problème de remboursement. Elle vend sur table divers produits culinaires et des légumes au marché central de se quartier, et son prêt lui permettra de mieux développer son activité commerciale et augmentant son niveau d'approvisionnement. Son objectif est de prendre en charge sa progéniture tout en subvenant à ses besoins personnels.
texts.en:
Diarry K. is a 51-year-old woman who is a widow and the mother of five children.  She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of KOUNK. V.W. since September 12, 2005.  She has 3½ years of experience and has had seven consecutive loans without ever a problem repaying.   On her table, Diarry sells a variety of kitchen products and vegetables at the central market of district.  Her loan will enable her to improve her business and to increase her stock of inventory.  Her goal is to take care of her children while supporting herself.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Bolstering and developing her revenue-generating business

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen D. is from the village of San Vicente, Dapitan City. She is 36 years old and has one school-aged child.  To make a living, Helen owns and operates a business that provides manicures and pedicures to local residents. Helen has been in business for over one year and earns approximately 1,600 PHP a month.

In 2009, Helen joined PMPC to access financial services to improve her living situation and to engage in business. Helen has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,900 PHP from PMPC.  Helen is requesting a new loan of 4,900 PHP to purchase materials needed for manicure and pedicure services. This loan will be her 3rd loan from PMPC.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions. 

---------------------------------------
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

loans.use: Purchase materials needed for manicure and pedicure services.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su octavo ciclo dentro del programa de comité de mujeres.
Una de las señora muy activas y con ganas de superarse constantemente es Paula A.  con 32 años de edad y  tiene 5 hijos, se dedica a la profesión modista.
Ella  confecciona ropas sobre medidas para damas y caballeros, además fabrica sabanas y manteles para mesas y los vende comercios de la zona, y a sus compañeras de comité.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de telas en gran cantidad y guata para la fabricación de edredones y sabanas.
texts.en:
This existing committee is in its eighth loan cycle as part of the Women’s Committee Program.

One of these active women with a constant desire to succeed is Paula A.. She is 32 years old, has five children, and works as a professional seamstress. Paula makes customized clothing for women and men. In addition, she manufactures bed sheets and tablecloths and sells them to businesses in the area and to her fellow committee members.

She is requesting a loan to buy a large quantity of fabrics and cotton for making comforters and bed sheets.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric & cotton

loans.name: Aguacate Group

texts.es:
El grupo el Aguacate está conformado por Silvia del Carmen L. G. quien vende ropa y comida desde hace cuatro años con el propósito de que sus dos hijas tengan un mejor futuro en especial su educación es que la mejor herencia que les puede dar.

Las otras integrantes son Eloisa L. G. quien comercializa ropa y Blanca Carolina Humbes Cruz comerciante de calzado y ropa desde varios años.
texts.en:
The “Aguacate” (Avocato) group includes Silvia del Carmen L. G., who’s been selling food and clothing for the past four years. She does this so that her two children will have a better future, especially a good education, which is the best inheritance she can give them. The other members are Eloisa L. G., who sells clothing, and Blanca Carolina Humbes Cruz, who has been selling shoes and clothing for several years.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Clothing for resale

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita B. is from the village of Sepac Sapang Dalaga, Misamis Occidental. She is 60 years old. Teresita is widowed and has 2 adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Teresita joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future. This will be the first loan taken out by Teresita from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future

loans.name: Jeanette

texts.en:
Jeanette G., 46, wants to achieve more in life not just for herself but for her family as well. Jeanette lives in GMA, Cavite, north of Manila with her husband, Antonio, who is a carpenter. They have seven children, one of which is in high school, three in elementary and the other three are working.

Jeanette has managed fruit vending business for 15 years now, which caters mainly to people near their residence in GMA. Jeanette buys variety of tropical fruits from local farmers in wholesale basis and sells the same with a minimum markup. Jeanette and Antonio gather a net income of Php3,050 monthly, which they use to meet the needs of the entire family.

She would like to apply for a Php9, 000 loan to purchase additional variety of fruits for selling. Jeanette has been a member of Center for Community Transformation since March 2005 and is faithfully attending their weekly fellowship meeting*. She hopes that this loan will increase volume of her fruit items to boost sales and eventually expand her business.

Jeanette is determined not to be swayed by problems and struggles in life and aims to make her business grow. She prays to find a commercial area where her business could thrive and flourish. More importantly, she dreams of seeing her children finish their studies and be used as one family for the glory of the Lord whom they serve.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: buy more varieties of fresh tropical fruits for selling

loans.name: Clara

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “NUEVA VICTORIA - CHINCHERO”;  Este banco está situado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco; situado a 45 minutos de la ciudad.

La socia Clara; La socia tiene 36 años de edad, ella es separada y tiene 4 hijos, La socia es artesana y trabaja con este rubro, ella paralelamente a esto esta tras comprar un terreno en su pueblo y requiere aumentar a lo que ella ya tiene ahorrado, La socia solicita el préstamo para aumentar y poder comprar su propio terreno.

La socia agradece el préstamo mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo estipulado.
texts.en:
The associate belongs to the "NEW VICTORY - CHINCHERO" communal bank. This bank is situated in the district of Chinchero, which belongs to the province of Urubamba and the department of Cusco, located 45 minutes from the city. The associate, Clara, is 36 years of age. She is separated and has 4 children. The associate is an artesan and works in this area. In conjunction with this she is seeking to buy land in her town and needs to add to what she has already saved. The associate requests the loan to add to her savings to be able to buy her own land. The associate is grateful for the loan granted in this way and at the same time promised to comply with the payments according to the schedule stipulated.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: La socia solicita el préstamo para aumentar y poder comprar su propio terreno.

loans.name: Kossiwa

texts.fr: K. kossiwa est une femme mariée et mère de 3 enfants, elle vit avec sa famille dans le quartier de djagble au nord de la ville de Lomé. elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de Liqueurs. le lieu de son approvisionnement est le grand marché de Lomé. elle fait face à une rupture de stock et sollicite par conséquent de wages un crédit pour l'achat de liqueurs afin de gonfler son stock et satisfaire ses clients
texts.en:
K. Kossiwa is a married woman with 3 children, and lives with her family in the Djagble area north of the city of Lomé. She runs an income-generating business selling liquor. She obtains her supplies at the grand market in Lomé. She is facing a stock shortage and is thus seeking a loan through WAGES (one of Kiva's field partners) to buy liquor in order to increase her stock and satisfy her customers.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and sell alcoholic beverages

loans.name: Crisanta

texts.en:
Crisanta S. is from the city of Panta-on Ozamis. She is 57 years old. Crisanta is married and has one adult child. Crisanta owns and operates a farm. The main source of income for the business comes from planting & harvesting flowers for sale. Crisanta has been engaged in her business for over 40 years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Crisanta joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Crisanta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from GDMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Crisanta is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to pay for services to increase crop yield. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Crisanta from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three units offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisher-folk and small entrepreneurs. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Napoleon Arnulfo

texts.es:
Napoleon de 57 años, tiene una tienda/panadería, vive con su esposa y cuatro hijos en el Guasmo de Guayaquil (zona urbana, la mayoría de habitantes son comerciantes informales)

Hace 25 años lo liquidaron de una empresa donde trabajaba aprovecho el dinero que le dio la empresa y compro víveres para ubicar una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, poco a poco con dedicación a podido surtir su tienda con una panadería. En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06h00am preparando panes hasta que termina y abre el negocio lo atiende hasta las 22h00pm. Cada pan lo vende a $ 0.07c/u, la libra de azúcar a $ 0.25, litro de leche a $ 0.85 etc. 

Con el préstamo quiere comprar azúcar, arroz, harina para su tienda/panadería y así incrementar su capital de trabajo. En el futuro quiere que su negocio crezca y tener mas clientela.
texts.en:
Napoleon is 57 years old and manages a general store and bakery. He lives with his wife and four children in Guasmo de Guayaquil, an urban area where most of the residents are informal merchants.

Twenty-five years ago, the company that Napoleon worked for went out of business. He used the money from his severance pay to buy groceries and opened a small store in the front part of his house. With a little bit of dedication, he was able to stock his store and add a bakery. He currently works from 6am preparing bread and then opens his business and looks after it until 10pm. Each loaf of bread sells for $0.07/each, a pound of sugar for $0.25, and a liter of milk for $0.85.

Napoleon will use the loan to buy sugar, rice, and flour for both his store and bakery, thereby increasing his operating capital. In the future, he wants to grow his business and attract more customers.

loans.use: Purchase sugar, rice, and flour

loans.name: Francisco Miguel

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “MERCAMUEBLE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Francisco Miguel; el tiene 35 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; el socio se dedica a realizar muebles como mesas, sillas y camas, el tiene un pequeño taller donde hace los muebles y después los vende en las ferias y por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos, el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de muebles. El socio solicita el préstamo para comprar madera al por mayor.


El socio agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Francisco Miguel, 35, has a live-in partner and two children.  He is a member of the “MERCAMUEBLE” communal bank located in Cusco district, Cusco province, Cusco department.

He manufactures different kinds of furniture.  He makes chairs, tables and beds.  He has a small shop where he makes the furniture that he then sells in the markets.   He supports his children through this business.  He wants to expand the furniture selling business and is asking for a loan to buy wood at wholesale.

He thanks all those who share in his dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

loans.use: To buy wood at wholesale.

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en: Vagif A. is a 55 years old shopkeeper who has been selling candies, sugar, cookies, beverages and other foodstuffs since 2005. He is married and has 3 children. Vagif would like to increase the number of products he sells and thus be able to improve his life conditions. He is asking for a loan  to purchase more merchandise to increase his  monthly sales.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory

loans.name: Kipelian Ole

texts.en:
Kipelian Ole N. is 37 years old. He is married to Lantano Kirtela and he is the father of two school children, ages five and eight years. 

Kipelian is a farmer and he does the farming on his own piece of land which he has been doing for the last five years.

He learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This will be his second loan. He is planning to spend 20,000 KES to hire farm machinery for harvesting his wheat. With the profits he hopes to make from the proceeds of this loan, he plans to hire more land for farming to increase his wheat output.

His future dream is that he will be able to buy a bigger piece of land whereby he can be planting more wheat in a larger scale.

Despite his age, Kipelian believes he is hard working and having the right resources at his disposal he can achieve a lot.

loans.use: To hire farm machinery for harvesting his wheat.

loans.name: Rosa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosa Elizabeth tiene 45 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el distrito de Eten, una zona conocida porque sus pobladores se dedican a la elaboración de artículos confeccionados de junto. Se encuentra ubicada a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Rosa cuenta con un establecimiento en su domicilio en donde ofrece en venta al público en general artículos de bazar como losería, adornos de cerámica, regalos y juguetes. El negocio ya tiene una antigüedad de tres años. Adicionalmente cuenta con un taller en donde confecciona gorros para vendérselos a un acopiador que llega a dejarle pedidos. 

Los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad le sirven para sacar adelante la economía de su familia. Su esposo trabaja como obrero de construcción y como chófer de mototaxi (vehículo motorizado utilizado para brindar servicio de transporte publico, consiste en una motocicleta a la que se a anexado una cabina para transportar carga y pasajeros).

Rosa desea ampliar su bazar con la compra de más artículos ya que durante esta temporada del año la demanda suele aumentar debido a las fiestas navideñas y de año nuevo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Rosa Elizabeth is 45 years old, she is married and she lives together with her husband and their children in the district of Eten. It is a region known for its merchants who produce their articles in a group and it is located half an hour from the city of Chiclayo. 

Rosa has a store set up in her house from where she sells to the general public items such as dishes, ceramic decorations, gifts, and toys. The business is three years old. She also has a shop from where she makes hats that she sells to a retailer who comes and places orders.

The income that she earns helps her to financially support her family. Her husband is a construction worker and he also drives a motorcycle rickshaw (a motorized vehicle used to provide public transport and it is a motorcycle with an attached cabin that may be used to carry passengers or cargo).

Rosa wishes to expand her bazaar with the purchase of more merchandise to be ready for the end of year Christmas celebrations and New Year's parties. To this end she has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Maria Esmeralda

texts.es:
Doña María Esmeralda R. E., vive en  chicoasen  Estado de Chiapas México es casada. Su esposo y ella tienen cuatro hijos  a su responsabilidad y son: Arleny Jazmín de once años en sexto de primaria el otro es Marlon de nueve años, Noelia de cinco años y el más pequeño es Ángel Noé de dos años.

     El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en  una nueva actividad que  es la de venta de zapatos de la marca Andrea, en esto lleva cuatro meses y comenta que le está yendo bien en este negocio.

     Se animo ya que es una actividad  en el cual se  puede apoyar cubriendo sus gastos pequeños generados en su hogar y en la educación de sus hijos que están estudiando.

      Para iniciar esta actividad  se informo como  es el negocio le agrado y es así como hoy está participando en este negocio en donde le va  bien.

       De la ganancia que valla obteniendo lo está invirtiendo en  lo mismo y con esto también cubrir sus pagos puntuales en  fundación realidad.

     Su sueño es que logre tener con el tiempo su propio negocio  en donde le dé buen rendimiento y pueda salir adelante con fu familia.
texts.en:
María Esmeralda R. E. lives in Chicoasén, in the State of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is married and has four children in her care: 11 year-old Arleny Jazmín who is in the sixth year of elementary school, 9 year-old Marlon, 5 year-old Noelia and her youngest, 2 year-old Ángel Noé.

María will invest her loan in a new business activity selling Andrea-brand shoes.  She has been in this business for 4 months and she tells us that it is going well.

María started this business because she wanted to be able to support her husband in covering their small household expenses and also support her children's education (her children are studying).  In order to set herself up in this business, María found out the business and liked what she learned.  She is now working in the business and it is going well.

María will re-invest the profits that she makes back into her business and also cover her loan repayments to Fundación Realidad which she will make punctually.  Her dream is to own her own business which will be very profitable and enable her to get herself and her family ahead in life.

loans.use: To buy shoe catalogs so that she can make orders and then make sales in her town

loans.name: Vicent

texts.en:
Vincent is a 41 year old married man with 3 children living in a rented house in Hioma Uganda. His goal and ambition is building his own house in the next three years. He is in  the maize and beans business and has been doing this for 3 years. Before this he was in the farming business. 

He is faced with a challenge of price fluctuations of produce and he hopes in the future to open up a second outlet. Vincent needs the loan to buy maize and beans to sell.

loans.use: Purchase of produce

loans.name: Bertha Leonor

texts.es:
Bertha es madre de una hija, labora en un hospital como nutricionista, desde hace varios años, así como venta de productos de nutrición para lograr equilibrar sus gastos.
Su casa la ha venido construyendo con préstamos que Afodenic ha otorgado en cinco ciclos, siendo ha plazos que puede pagar. Con su crédito anterior logro hacer el arranque donde estará el baño pero por falta de materiales no termino, lo que hará con este préstamo comprara más piedra, arena, cemento, laminas de zinc, cuartones, clavos y otros  para continuar la construcción y lograr la mejora
texts.en:
Bertha is a mother with one daughter. She has worked at a hospital as a nutritionist for several years. In addition, she sells nutritional products to help balance her expenses.

Her house was built using loans from AFODENIC. She has participated in five loan cycles and is still capable of making her payments. With her previous loan, Bertha was able to start remodeling her bathroom but was not able to finish due to a shortage of materials. This loan will be used to buy more stone, sand, cement, sheets of zinc, lumber, nails, and other items so that she can continue the construction and complete this improvement.

loans.use: Purchase construction materials needed to finish a bathroom

loans.name: Lydia Muthoni

texts.en:
Lydia, age 26, has practised agriculture in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last six years. She and her husband, Joseph Gikonyo, have two children.  

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by her friend and this will be her second loan. She off her first loan of Kshs 30,000 regularly and promptly. She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Lydia hopes to practice large-scale farming.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Anna Ruby

texts.en:
Anna Ruby R. is from Labuyo Tangub City. She is 43 years old. Anna Ruby is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Anna Ruby owns and operates a general store. Anna Ruby has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month. 

In 2008, Anna Ruby joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Anna Ruby has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. Anna Ruby is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Anna Ruby from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:
GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Estela

texts.en: Estela is a married woman who lives in Cadiz, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a tricycle transportation business. Her husband Eusebio, who is 46 years old, works as a tricycle driver to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have four children who are between 5 and 21 years old. Estela joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2001 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Estela has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 12,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 8,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 14,000 to pay for more maintenance on her motorcycle so that she can continue to save up for her children's future education. Estela is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

loans.use: To maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Ervina

texts.en:
Ervina is 46 years old and married with nine children.

She earns a living by raising carabao (water buffalo), pigs and goats in the Philippines. Ervina is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to raise.

Ervina has been in business for five years and earns additional income from her general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream:  to finish her children's education.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 25 years old and is a widow without children. She has had a restaurant for one year. She employs one person. Rehema works from 8am until 7pm every day. She realized that she lacks sufficient equipment to offer a quality service in her restaurant. 

Rehema has requested her first loan from Kiva partner, Vision Finance Company s.a, to expand her business by buying more goods like sambusa, capati and bread. With this expansion, Rehema hopes to make more profit and this will enable her to buy her own house and save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like sambusa, capati and bread

loans.name: Yaver

texts.ru: Yaver A. 43 qoda. On jenat i imeyet uje dvux detey odin iz kotorix uchitsya v shkole. Yavar yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli qoroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione, posolok Kurdmakhmudlu vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. Yavar uje 2 qoda kak rabotayet taxistom, ranshe on zanimalsya skotovodstvom no potom reshil pomenyat svoy bizness i etim nachal imet bolshe priboli. Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Yavera v perviy raz on blar 800$ za chto on blagodaren lenderam i Kive, on uspeshno vernul ssudu. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye zapchasti dlya pochinki svoyey mashini.
texts.en: Yaver A. is 43 years old.  His is married and has two children, one of whom is still in school.  Yavar is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person).  He is a refugee from Fuzuli city who now lives with his beloved family in the Fuzuli region in Kurdmakhmudlu village. Yavar has been driving a taxi for two years.  Before that, he was a herdsman, but he decided to change professions to receive a greater income. This is his second loan.  The first time, Yaver borrowed $800.  He is very thankful to Kiva lenders, and successfully repaid the loan.  Now he needs 2000 AZN to buy repair parts to fix his car.

loans.use: to buy parts to repair his car

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years.  Josephine has requested a 17,000 Philippine peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell. 

In the future, Josephine would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung is a 57-year-old female living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh. Dung is the group leader of a six-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Diên Lộc nhóm 01 (1).

Dung is married with four grown children. Dung owns and operates a business selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over two years and earns approximately 3.000.000 VND a month.

In 2010, Dung joined SEDA to gain access to financial services.  Dung has repaid loans previously taken out of 5,152,000 VND.  This loan was used to purchase ingredients such as wheat, rice, beef for breakfast sales.  She is now requesting a loan of 7,392,000 VND to buy feed for the chickens, to buy bowls, chopsticks purchased for the business process.  Monday will be taken out loans.  Plans to use additional income from business to improve overall living conditions of families.

About the Other Borrowers in the Group:

1.  Ly is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her cattle livestock business.


2.  Bắc is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support business and to buy feed for pigs.


3.  Thành is a 24-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business such as tables, chairs, beds. .


4.  Hoa is a 39-year-old female who is requesting a 6.944.000 VND loan to buy food for her pig business.


5.  May is a 24-year-old male who is requesting a 5.152.000 VND loan to buy food for his pigs and chickens.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Dung là 57 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Dung là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Diên Lộc nhóm 01 (1).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán thức ăn nhanh & những loại thực phẩm cao cấp khác trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Dung thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 2 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Dung kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2010, Dung đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy.  Dung đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua các thành phần thô cần thiết để chế tạo sản phẩm để bán.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 7.392.000 VND để mua thức ăn cho gà và mua bát đũa kinh doanh hàng ăn sáng.


Khoản vay sẽ là 2nd khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Ly là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi bò.


2.  Bắc  là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh  để hỗ trợ kinh doanh và mua thức ăn cho lợn .


3.  Thành là 24 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất như bàn, ghế,giường.


4.  Hoa  là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.944.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi mua thức ăn cho lợn.


5.  May là 24 tuổi nam.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi và mua thức ăn cho lợn, gà.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to buy feed for the chickens, to buy bowls, chopsticks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the purchase and insurance of a dairy cow.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan de 50 años, reside en la localidad de Alto Yapaz (selva central peruana). Ahí formó su familia junto a Marina, su esposa desde hace 26 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos a los que cuida con mucho amor y cariño en su casa propia. El trabajo al que se dedica este humilde hombre, es la agricultura, en el cual tiene 4 años de experiencia. En sus 9 terrenos agrícolas siembra plátano, café y rocoto; los cuales cuida con mucho esmero y dedicación. Ya que sabe lo difícil que es mantenerlos, según cuenta el rocoto tarda 2 años en poder dar fruto después de la siembra. Ahora ya está floreando y espera obtener buenos resultados en la cosecha, ya que con la experiencia que posee los mismos compradores visitan su chacra para poder comprar su producción. Como un buen padre de familia, responsable y con aspiraciones para sus hijos, hace poco alquiló una casa en la ciudad de Huancayo, donde sus hijos están estudiando educación superior en una universidad estatal reconocida, por ello su esposa se traslado ahí para poder cuidarlos. Está nueva etapa lo impulso a dedicarse al trabajo de albañil en sus tiempos libres, pues gana más en este oficio, según afirma un promedio de 3 mil a 4 mil nuevos soles mensuales, con los que espera concretar el objetivo de sacar adelante a sus hijos. Él pertenece al banco comunal “El palomar al éxito” y este es el primer crédito con MFP, donde espera de su colaboración para lograr sus objetivos. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Además le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Juan de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para esparcirlos en sus cultivos de plátanos que sembró hace 2 meses y que tiene que ser fertilizados constantemente.
texts.en:
Juan, 50 years old, resides in the locality of Alto Yapaz (in Peru's central rain forest). Here he formed his family with Marina, his wife for 26 years. Together they have 4 children who are cared for with much love and affection in their own house.

This humble man is dedicated to agriculture, and he has 4 years experience. On his 9 plots of land he sows plantains, coffee, and chili peppers, which he cares for with much dedication. He has learned how difficult it is to maintain them, and he tells us that after planting the peppers they were delayed 2 years in producing. Now they are flowering and he hopes to obtain good results at harvest, and due to his experience, buyers are visiting his farm to buy his production.

Like a good family man, responsible and with aspirations for his children, he recently rented a house in the city of Huancayo, where his children are studying at a recognized state university. His wife has moved there to care for them. This new era has motivated him to work as a brick layer in his free time, since he earns more in this work -- as much as 3,000 or 4,000 new sols per month -- with which he hopes to realize his objective of advancing his children.

Juan belongs to “El Palomar al Exito” (The Dovecote for Success) Communal Bank and this is his 1st loan with MFP, where he hopes for your collaboration to achieve his objectives. He, in turn, promises to comply with his schedule of payments, as with his previous loans. Moreover, he is pleased to be part of his communal bank because all the members are responsible people with much solidarity.

Upon obtaining his loan, Juan will invest in various sacks of organic manure to spread on the plantain crops he planted some 2 months ago and that have to be fertilized constantly.

loans.use: buy sacks of organic manure for his plantain crop.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is 34 years old and lives in San Antonio, Ilagan, Isabela. He is married, and his wife works as a domestic helper in another country. Abraham says that he wants to save money to help his wife to earn an income and come back to the Philippines to stay with him and their only child. That's why he works hard in his farm business. He plants and harvests rice and corn. 

Abraham is requesting a loan of 27,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizer and seeds, and to finance the other needs of his farm. He makes his purchases in the market and sells in the wholesale market in the same town.

The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs. His plan is to save money for the future of his child and also for his wife.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Osman

texts.en:
Osman is 35 years old and married with four children, aged between 7 and 18. He runs a General Merchandise store in Lumley, a neighborhood in Freetown. He also has four relatives to take care of as well as his immediate family.   

Osman has owned this business for five years and sells rice, flour, sugar and oil at his store. He also earns income from renting a house out to tenants. He says that the main challenge to his business is that during the rainy season business is relatively slow. 

He requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more rice, sugar and flour. Osman says that the extra income from this loan will help him improve the standard of living of his family. In the future, he would like to import goods from overseas.

loans.use: To purchase more rice, sugar and flour.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en: Kamil  is 29 years old and sells fruits and vegetables in the central market of Agsu district. Kamil is married and has two children. He has about five years of experience in this field. Now he has already completed his first loan from AqroInvest CU and is applying for the next one. He wishes to increase his monthly profit and to improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: purchase more goods to sell.

loans.name: Badji

texts.fr:
Badji est un homme âgé de 34 ans. Il est marié å une couturière. Il a 01 enfant.
Badji travaille comme revendeur de télévision, et de ventilateur depuis 2008. Il vend à ses clients dans un quartier de la place. Il achète les produits à LOME. 
Badji a requis son second cycle de prêt à WAGES afin d’acheter des télévisions, des CD, DVD, des radios.
texts.en:
Badji is a 34-year-old man who is married to a clothier. He has one child. 

Badji has been working as a retailer of televisions and electric fans since 2008. He makes his sales in a local district. He purchases his supplies in Lomé. 

Badji has requested his second loan at the micro-finance institution WAGES in order to buy televisions, CD's, DVD's, and radios.

loans.use: to buy televisions, CD's, DVD's, and radios

loans.name: Ysabel

texts.es:
Ysabel de 64 años, es soltera, vive en su casa propia, cuenta con todos los servicios básicos, ubicado en el distrito de Chepén que pertenece al departamento de Lambayeque.  Zona de actividad comercial, agrícola y turismo.

Ysabel cuenta con su negocio de comida y venta de gaseosas en su domicilio, actividad que realiza desde  hace 4 años, cuenta con su propia clientela, es conocida por la limpieza y la buena sazón que tiene, con los ingresos que adquiera podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y cubrirá sus necesidades diarias.

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa  de 2500 nuevos soles para comprar insumos, utensilios y una refrigeradora que le ayudar a tener las bebidas heladas, para  seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes y con sus ganancias cubrir sus gastos personales.  Ysabel con su trabajo y sus ganas de salir adelante se ha ganado la confianza de sus clientes, con la finalidad de que más adelante tenga un negocio grande donde ofrezca todo tipo de comida.
texts.en:
64-year-old Ysabel is single.  She lives in her own home which has all basic services and is located in Chepén district, in Lambayeque department.  This area is noted for its commercial activity, farming and tourism.

Ysabel has a business selling food and soda from her home.  She has been in this business for four years and has her own customer base.  She is known for her hygiene and the good taste of her food.  She will use her income to create a better quality of life for herself and cover her daily needs.

Ysabel has requested a loan for 2,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy supplies, utensils and a fridge to help her keep her drinks cold.  This will enable her to continue providing her customers with a good service.  She will use her profits to cover her personal expenses.  Through her work and her desire to get ahead in life, Ysabel has gained the trust of her customers.  Her aim for the future is to have a large business offering all kinds of food.

loans.use: to buy supplies, utensils and a fridge

loans.name: Verena

texts.en: Verena is married with seven children who are aged between one and 15 years old. Her husband works in construction. She has a restaurant that she has been running for seven years. She sells many different African dishes. The restaurant has enabled her to care for her children. She needs a loan to buy more foodstuffs such as rice, sugar, beans, potatoes and vegetables. With the profits she wishes to expand her business and pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs e.g. rice, sugar, beans, potatoes, vegetables, etc. to cook in her restaurant

loans.name: Lucily

texts.en:
Lucily works hard to support her family. Lucily is married and has a sari sari store business in the Philippines.

Lucily requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries etc. in her sari sari store.

Lucily has been in this business for 5 years now.

In the future, Lucily would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy items to sell in her sari sari store

loans.name: Alaphia

texts.en:
Alaphia is 45 years old and widowed with two children, ages 4 and 18. She runs a bar and restaurant in Cabalatown, a neighborhood in Freetown. One of her children is currently attending school.

Alaphia has been in her business for four years, selling drinks and food at her bar and restaurant. She also earns income from renting out a house. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more drinks and prepared foods.  Alphaia says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her standard of living. In the future, she would like to open more branches of her business.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and prepared foods.

loans.name: Loy

texts.es: Loy, de 27 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora, emprendedora y dinámica, vive en compañía de su Victor su pareja y de sus cuatro hijos en su casa propia. La actividad que realiza Loy es la venta de comida al paso como salchipapas, salchipollos, para lo cual cuenta con un carrito o stand móvil que lo estaciona frente a su casa durante las noches. Es así que atiende a todos sus clientes, quienes en su mayoría son vecinos, y amigos. Tiene dos años dedicandose a este trabajo, y en el que su pareja le ofrece todo su apoyo atendiendo a los clientes. Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el contar con un ingreso económico que le permita ayudar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar. Tiene planes de ampliar su negocio y abrir un restaurante con todos los implementos necesarios. Este seria el tercer crédito con MFP, por tanto espera el apoyo de ustedes. Con el monto solicitado, comprará una refrigeradora para conservar los alimentos perecibles para la preparación de sus platillos.
texts.en:
Loy, 27, is a hardworking, enterprising and dynamic woman living with her spouse, Víctor, and their four children in her own house.  Loy sells fast food like ‘salchipapas’ [fried potatoes with sausage] and ‘salchipollo’ [fried potatoes with chicken] from a little cart or movable stand that she parks in front of her house during the evening.  This is how she takes care of all her customers who for the most part are neighbors and friends.  She’s been in this line of work for two years and her spouse is most supportive taking care of customers.

What she likes about her work is having income that allows her to help her spouse with household expenses.  She plans to expand the business and open a restaurant with all the necessary furnishings.

This will be the 3rd MFP loan and she hopes for support from all of you.  She will use the requested amount to buy a refrigerator to store the perishables she uses to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her food preparation.

loans.name: Gloria Onorinda

texts.es:
Gloria Onorinda tiene 53 años de edad es soltera no tiene hijos vive en el cantón Chillane Provincia de Bolívar.
LA VRC SAN JOSE, está conformada por 21 socios y socias se encuentra ubicada en la parroquia San José del Tambo a 60 minutos de la oficina. Esta Ventanilla se dedica a Labores Agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz, plátano, cacao.
Gloria se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y cacao las compras y las ventas las realiza en la Parroquia San José del Tambo. Solicita el Crédito para comprar semillas, abonos y fertilizantes para mejorar e incrementar la producción.
El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque podrá mejorar la calidad de vida y el producto. Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuentes son: la competencia. El sueño comprarse más terrenos.
Se considera un apersona tranquila, trabajadora, puntual, responsable, unida, le gusta caminar y disfrutar del carnaval.
texts.en:
Gloria Onorinda, 53, is single and has no children.  She lives in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

The “San José” communal bank consists of 21 members, both men and women, and is located in San José del Tambo Parish sixty minutes from the office.  This communal bank is dedicated to short cycle corn, banana and cocoa bean farming.

Gloria is a corn, banana and cocoa bean farmer.  Her purchases and sales take place in San José del Tambo Parish.  She’s asking for the loan to buy seeds and farming supplies like urea, Matamonte [herbicide], fertilizer and weed killer to keep her crops in good condition.

The loan will be very helpful because she’ll be able to improve her quality of life and the product.  The challenges she faces are very frequent: competition and pests.  Her dream is that her son completes his schooling.  In her free time she likes playing sports, especially volleyball, and she is very cooperative.

loans.use: semillas, abonos y fertilizantes

loans.name: Janarbek

texts.en:
Janarbek is 31 years old and lives with his wife and three children in his own house in Bayan-Ulgii province, Mongolia. His wife is unemployed; his elder son is 8 years old and goes in local primary school, his two younger daughters, 5 and 3 years old, go to kindergarten. 

Janarbek has been doing a car repair on call service since 2000. Now he has managed to establish his own auto repair center, and he buys old cars to repair and sell. He is a courteous and decent man who says, "Enlarging my auto repair center will benefit my business." He needs a 1,500,000 MNT loan to buy old cars.

loans.use: To buy old cars.

loans.name: Betty Kawira

texts.en: Betty Kawira, 33 years old, is married and has a two-year-old son. She describes herself as a hopeful woman. She has been running a grocery store for the past six years. Her business is faced with the problems of customers delaying their payments and increased cost of goods when buying them. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy farm products. In the next five years, Betty wants to expand her business by increasing the turnover of the goods sold.

loans.use: To add stock of farm products.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery sigue participando en el banco comunal “Choquequirao” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad del Cusco. 

Mery sigue trabajando en la venta de artesanía como por ejemplo tejidos, chalinas, guantes, gorros, mantillas, mantas grandes, ponchos, chalecos y adorno en cerámica.

Mery con el anterior crédito le fue muy bien y pudo obtener buenos beneficios y por ese motivo desea otro préstamo pues le ayuda mucho en el negocio.

Mery solicita el préstamo para invertir en la comprar mantas, estandartes, ropa para santos, chullos y entre otros. 
	
Mery se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Mery continues participating in the communal bank Choquequirao in the Asociación Arariwa in the city of Cusco.

Mery is still working selling handicrafts such as weavings, scarves, gloves, hats, shawls, large blankets, ponchos, vests, and ceramic ornaments.

Mery, with the last loan, did very well and she was able to make a good profit and this is the reason she wants another loan as it helps her very much in the business.

Mery is asking for a loan to buy blankets, decorative banners, holiday clothing, woolen caps, and other items.

Mery is grateful for the opportunity this loan gives her and at the same time she promises to make her payments according to the schedule.

loans.use: to buy basic materials for her business

loans.name: Felecitas

texts.en:
Felecitas is a 62-year-old woman from Campo 1, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. Felecitas is a widow with two children.

To earn a living, Felecitas runs a general store, where she sells a variety of food and everyday products (including candy, cigarettes, shampoo, and soap) to members of her local community. Felecitas explains that she has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and that she earns approximately 4,600 PHP per month from these activities.

Felecitas is requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items so that she can expand her product offerings. In 2008, Felecitas joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services, which enabled her to improve the business and her living situation. She plans to save any additional revenue generated from the loan as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to increase inventory by purchasing additional items.

loans.name: Abdurahmonkhoja

texts.ru: Абдурахмонходжа проживает в городе Исфара. Он женат. Ему 57 лет. У него двое детей. Абдурахмонходжа более 30 лет занимается изготовлением мебели. Этим видом деятельности занимается у себя дома. Кредит берет для приобретения досок.
texts.en: Abdurahmonkhoja lives in Isfara.  He is a 57-year-old married man with two children.  Abdurahmonkhoja has been engaged in the furniture-making business for over 30 years.  He makes furniture at home.  He is taking out a loan to buy furniture boards.

loans.use: To buy furniture boards

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is married and has two children aged two and twelve years. She describes herself as friendly and caring woman. 

She sells clothes, shoes, earrings and necklaces to new and repeat customers. She has been in this business for the last four years. 

She describes her business challenge to be high price of shoes. She will be using the KES 10,000 loan to buy belts, clothes, rings, earrings and necklaces. 

In the next five years, Caroline dreams to venture into new business of exporting shoes to Uganda.

loans.use: To buy belts, clothes, rings, earrings and necklaces.

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is divorced and has two children. After college she had several different jobs. However, she soon realized that her best opportunity would be to have her own business. In 1996, she was able to start a small business selling women’s clothing. 

Mariya is a very friendly, persevering and hard-working lady. Being a sociable person, she relates easily with her clients. Every time you pass by her kiosk you can find her talking to a new person who will most likely end up buying something. 

Mariya is requesting a loan of 6,000 grivnas to increase seasonal inventories. She is planning to purchase a variety of suits, jackets, coats and sweaters in bulk for further retail sale. The loan will be beneficial to her business by promoting its expansion which will further assist Mariya in meeting her household expenses and allow her to set aside some savings for future needs.

loans.use: to increase seasonal inventories

loans.name: Maurice Odumba

texts.en:
Maurice is the oldest borrower, he was born in Masita Village. Maurice is a farmer and has been involved in informal business and farming for many years. Maurice wants to own a motorcycle to support the community health work in his community, his motocycle will be linked with CHW working in ndhiwa and will  support the community health worker by providing transport on set days, this will give the needed capacity to the CHW to be able to reach many more families during  counseling appointments and health visitation. Maurice hopes to support the community health outreach programme by encouraging the youth to follow health advices given by CHWs and other community health teams.

Maurice will also use the income generated from his motorcycle business to support his larger family repair his house and buy a grade cattle.

loans.use: To buy a Motorcycle for Community Health Work and Livelihoods

loans.name: Camera Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Camera” group. They are small scale business-people based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of 5,000,000.00 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, make more profit and consequently improve on their standard of living. 

The featured leader of this group is Ya Rugie. Ya Rugie is age 38; she was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a teacher and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. Ya Rugie sells firewood, water, drinks, etc. With this loan, Ya Rugie will expand her business by buying firewood, drinks, water, etc. in large quantities for sale. 

(Attached in the photo is a snap shot of a borrower who was not able to be present for a group photo).

loans.use: to buy firewood, drinks, water, etc. in large quantities for sale.

loans.name: Unu Urpu De Chaupimayo-Huarqqui Group

texts.es:
La socia Victaria pertenece al banco  comunal UNU URPU DE CHAUPIMAYO-HUARQQUI,el banco está ubicado en el distrito de Lamay ,provincia de de Calca y departamento de Cusco.
La socia tiene 19 años de edad y es conviviente, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la crianza de animales menores, la socia lleva buen tiempo dedicándose este negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia cría a sus  animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de alimentos para sus animales.
La socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Victaria is a member of the communal bank UNU URPU DE CHAUPIMAYO-HUARQQUI. The bank is located in the Lamay district in the province of Calca in the Cusco region.

The member is 19 years old and lives with her partner. She divides her day among different activities. She makes a living raising young animals. She has been in this business for years and it has been doing very well thanks to the effort she puts in every day. The member raises her small animals to later sell them to her clients that ask for them. The member wishes to keep working in the same way in order to carry on supporting her family.

The member is asking for a loan to purchase feed for her animals. 

The member is grateful for this loan and promises to comply with the established payment terms.

loans.use: to purchase feed for her animals.

loans.name: Grupo Zunilito Sector Campo Group

texts.es:
Iris es una mujer de 35 años de edad es casada con una linda familia de cinco hijos de las edades entre siete y dieciocho años, ellos viven en una comunidad de zunilito.
Iris (la primera del lado izquierdo) trabaja mucho para obtener sus ingresos y sacar adelante a su familia, ella se dedica a la repostería profesional, con esta actividad lleva 4 años de dedicarse a esta labor, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su casa de habitación, pero también es vendedora ambulante de comida.
Iris con el afán de mejorar sus servicios hacia sus clientes a decidido solicitar un préstamo que lo invertirá en la compra de moldes y bases para pasteles, pues la competencia casa día es más fuerte por esa razón ella debe ir mejorando la presentación de su producto. Su gran esperanza de vida es tener su propio local de negocio y que su negocio sea grandemente reconocido.

loans.use: Compra de moldes y bases para pasteles.

loans.name: Osagiduwa

texts.en: "LAPO has brought rain to my financial desert ever since I became a member," says Mrs. Osagiduwa O.. She is 34 years old with 6 children. Her business specializes in selling cooked food to the community. She is from an urban area of Bini in Nigeria.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase livestock and build a cattle shed for his dairy farming business

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok Keng is a mother of 2 children and lives with her husband in a part of Preyveng province, Cambodia. She and her husband make a living by purchasing fish from a fisherman and reselling it at retail. With this business activity, Sok Keng, who is 29 years old, typically makes in average about $7/day in revenue, which is a big help for her family's expenses. Moreover, she is asking for a $1000 loan to purchase more fish to keep investing in her business and with this amount of loan, she hopes to expand her business as well as make additional income.

In the future, if she saves enough money, she would like to run a big grocery store with a variety of products to meet her clients' demand.

loans.use: To purchase fish to invest in her business.

loans.name: Duong

texts.en: Mrs. Duong Y. is 41 years old and lives with her three children in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia. One of her children is a student, another is a garment worker and the third is still too young to go to school. She earns her money by selling vegetables, but she would now like to expand her inventory. She hopes to use this proposed loan in order to purchase additional vegetable products.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to expand inventory.

loans.name: Elsa Loyda

texts.en:
With creativity and cleverness, Elsa was able to get into the business of manufacturing shoes for artistic shows. It all started 19 years ago, when she and her husband began repairing shoes for her neighbors. She learned this noble profession from her husband, whom also acquired the skills from his family. Today, they believe they have been successful since they were able to open a location that allows them to support their five children. Their willingness to keep their family together, has motivated them to keep working hard, fulfilling all the manufacturing orders and not just repairing them. With their dressmaking skills, they supplement their business by making fashionable suits. Their small store has been growing steadily, always with the purpose of improving the quality of their clothes. She is asking for a loan of US$175 that will be invested in buying more supplies for their small tailoring business. Let’s support a family that wishes to continue tailoring their noble dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Gabriel Santamaria, Kiva Volunteer.

Con creatividad e ingenio, Elsa, logró incursionar en la fabricación de zapatos para espectáculos artísticos. Todo comenzó hace 19 años cuando en una esquina de su barrio ella y su esposo empezaron a arreglar los zapatos de sus vecinos, este oficio digno lo aprendió de su esposo quién también obtuvo esta enseñanza de su familia y hoy se sienten satisfechos porque han podido establecerse en un local que les permite sostener a sus cinco hijos El deseo de mantener a su familia siempre unida la impulsa a seguir trabajando con diligencia, cubriendo pedidos de fabricación y ya no sólo reparándolos; con sus conocimientos de costura complementa el traje de las prendas para los espectáculos y su pequeño negocio ha ido creciendo notablemente siempre con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de sus prendas. Solicita un préstamo de 175 dólares que los invertirá en la compra de más insumos para su pequeño taller de confección. Solidaricémonos con una familia que anhela seguri confeccionando sus nobles sueños.

loans.use: Buying supplies for manufacturing fashionable clothing.

loans.name: Sobirdgon

texts.ru:
Sobirdgon K., 23, is married. Sobirdgon sells clothing for children and shoes for women and children at the newly-built market “Balakh” in Rudaky region. Sobirdgon plans to use the loan to purchase an assortment of goods to attract more customers. He plans to repay the loan within 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбонов Собирджон, возраст – 23 лет, образование среднее, женат. Клиент имеет торговую точку на рынке «Балх» района Рудаки, который был построен несколько месяцев назад. Продаваемый товар это детские вещи, калоши, женская и детская обувь. На полученный кредит Собирджон хочет приобрести большее количество продаваемого товар. Так как рынок новый и количество посетителей данного нового рынка незначительное, он хочет увеличить ассортимент продаваемого товара, тем самым привлечь внимание покупателей к этому рынку, а именно к своему магазину. Данный кредит поможет жителям близлежащих домов расположенных с этим рынком приобретать необходимые им товары, так как большой аналогичный рынок находится за чертой города. Клиент планирует выплатить кредит в течение 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of goods sold

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Señora Victoria lives in the Mariscal Caceres province, Juanjui district, San Martin department. She is dedicated to sell groceries, clothes, plastic articles, and ice creams. Her business is located within her home in a suitable place for her sales. She has been in this business for 4 years. During that time she became a member of the "El Tiempo es Oro" (Time is gold) Community Bank. She came up with the idea of having her own business because she had the need of supporting her household and be useful. At the present time, she has a varied business and is also working with her youngest daughter who helps her with the administration of it and together they are making the business grow day by day

With the 2,000 soles (Peruvian currency) loan, which she will pay back in 6 months, she will buy goods to supply her business like 2 sacks of rice, 2 sacks of sugar (each sack is 50 kg), 2 packets of oil, 2 boxes of soap, detergent packets, one sack of potatoes and one of onions, some clothing, and others. She will be able to supply her business and serve it with the same kindness, happiness, and sense of responsibility that characterizes her day by day relations with her loyal customers.

Señora Victoria is 69 years old. She has seven children which she is still in charge of two of them. She lives with her husband which is three years older and a grandson whcih she cares for everyday. She shows us that there are no age limits if you want to move forward only you have to work with dedication and perseverance.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Victoria vive en la provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, distrito D. Juanjui, departamento D. San Martín. Se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes, ropa, artículos D. plástico y helados, su negocio está ubicado en su casa en un local adecuado para sus ventas. Se dedica al negocio desD. hace 04 años, tiempo en el que ingreso al Banco Comunal “El Tiempo es Oro”. La idea del negocio fue propia, sentía la necesidad D. apoyar en el hogar y ser útil. Actualmente cuenta con un negocio variado y está trabajando con su menor hija, quien la apoya en la administración del mismo y juntas están haciendo que el negocio crezca día a día. Con el préstamo D. S/.2,000.00, el cual pagará en 6 meses, comprará artículos para abastecer el negocio como dos sacos D. arroz, dos sacos D. azúcar (cada saco D. 50kg), dos paquetes D. aceite, dos cajas D. jabón, paquetes D. detergente, un saco D. papa y cebolla, algunas prendas D. vestir y otros, para así poder abastecer y atender con la misma amabilidad, alegría y responsabilidad que la caracteriza a sus clientes que día a día le muestran su fidelidad. La señora Victoria tiene 69 años, siete hijos D. los cuales dos están aún a su cargo. Vive con su esposo tres años mayor que ella y un nieto por lo que tiene que velar día a día y nos demuestra que para salir adelante no hay límites D. edad sólo hay que trabajar con dedicación y perseverancia. .

loans.use: Buying groceries to sell (rice, sugar, oil, soap, etc)

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.en:
Julio Cesar J. was born on May 22, 1957 in the city of Luque.  He has lived there his entire life and has been married since the age of twenty-five to Georgina Quiñonez Avalos. Together they have seven children, three who are still in high school.  Julio is a traveling merchant who, along with two other men, sell chairs, tables, and other pieces of wood furniture.  

Currently, Julio receives financial assistance from his eldest son Agustin, a carpenter, and his wife Rosana, a fashion designer.  He wishes to become independent from his son’s help, since soon his son will have a family of his own to support.  In order to become independent, Julio needs a loan to increase the amount of goods he is selling.  With the money, he will buy more wood, chairs, and large and small tables.

loans.use: To buy wood, chairs, stools, and small and large tables.

loans.name: Maher

texts.en: Maher is 26 years old and lives in the town of Saida in south Lebanon. He owns a restaurant, and this is the second time he has applied for a loan from A. Majmoua. He plans to use this new loan to expand his business. Maher is also planning to buy a car and the revenue generated by this loan will help him pay for it.

loans.use: To expand and upgrade a restaurant

loans.name: Rita

texts.pt:
Rita Vasco T. was born in the district of Boane in the province of Maputo in 1971. She was married at 20, and had 3 children. She studied until the 5th grade, but this was a time when women were discriminated against and she was not allowed to continue her education. She started her business in 2002 to help support her family.

Rita was introduced to HLUVUKU through her neighbors. With the loan of 15.000mt she plans on buying more chicks. The income from the business complements her husband’s income in providing for the family. She plans on growing her business from 250 chicks per lot to 500.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Localização: Bairro 07 - Boane Cliente: Rita Vasco T. Actividade: Avicultura – Engorde de Pintos Aplicação: Compra de pintos e Ração Valor de Empréstimo:15.000,00MT Inicio:29/02/2008 Fim: 30/06/2009 Rita Vasco T. Nasceu no Distrito de Boane Província de Maputo em 1971. Casada Maritalmente aos 20 anos de idade e mãe de 3 filhos. Estudou ate a 5ª classe, mas era numa época em que as mulheres eram descriminadas pelos pais, favorecendo mais os homens, dizia-se que o lugar da mulher é na machamba e em casa para cuidar dos filhos. Começou a praticar o negocio em 2002, devido as dificuldades de conseguir ingresso para o sustento da familia. Descobre a HLUVUKU graças as vizinhas e amigas que também são clientes.

Com o emprestimo de 15.000,00MT pretende comprar pintos para engorde com ração, vacinas e vitaminas. A actividade avicola ajuda a proponente a ganhar receitas para ajudar o marido no sustento dos 3 filhos. Tem como perspectiva fazer crescer o seu negocio de 250 para 500 pintos por lote.

loans.use: Chickens Production

loans.name: Mirian Cristina

texts.en:
Mirian Cristina is a young and budding entrepreneur who makes a living selling women’s clothing in her hometown of Los Roche community in San Cristobal.
