Moses is a farmer from Kitale town in western Kenya where he has been farming for 10 years now. His mixed farm is currently producing tomatoes, vegetables and maize, which are all sold locally. He earns additional income from his motorcycle transport business and a small video shop in the same town. He is 46 years old and married with three children who all attend school.

Moses has made a loan request of 40,000 KES in order to purchase chickens to enable him to practice poultry farming. He says that by diversifying his farming activities, he will be guaranteed a stable income and this will enable him to meet the basic needs of his family. His major challenges in this business have been diseases and the high cost of production, which affects his output. He is optimistic that his poultry farm will do well and that he will be one of the major suppliers of eggs in his town.

loans.use: To purchase chickens

loans.name: Siyabonna Group

texts.en:
Rebecca is 45 years old and single with four children, between 14 and 27 years old. Three of her children attend school. For the last two years, she has been operating a retail store near the pension pay point in Empangeni, South Africa, selling tupperware, perfume and clothes. She also receives a grant from the South African government to support her children.

Rebecca requested a loan from WDB and Kiva to purchase clothes to increase the selection she offers at her store. Her business has been growing, and she is now able to afford a house with furniture. Rebecca said that the support she received from WDB has greatly improved her life. In the photo she is pictured raising her hand.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 55 years old.  He is married to Magdaline.  He runs a hotel and a shop and has been doing it for the past thirteen years, with a monthly profit of KES.20,000 for his primary business and KES.10,000 for the secondary business.  He is requesting KES.30,000, with which he plans to purchase stock for the hotel, like big sufurias (cooking pots) and foodstuff like rice, beans, kale, etc.   With the anticipated profit, he plans to open another hotel.  In the future, he hopes to have a five-star hotel.

loans.use: to purchase stock for the hotel, like big sufurias (pots) for cooking,  and foodstuff like rice, beans, kale, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 33 years old and lives in Congo Town. He is married and his wife is a businesswoman. They have three children who are between 2 and 7 years old. All of them are in school and live with their parents. For the past five years, he has been selling sporting materials like footballs, basketballs, and football boots among others. He is requesting a loan to purchase more sporting materials for his shop. He plans to build a bigger store in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase more sporting materials for his shop

loans.name: Elmer Arturo

texts.es: Elmer Arturo de 36 años de edad,  reside en casa propia junto con su grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa de 32 años y sus dos hijos. Para Elmer su familia lo es todo y es por quién trabaja duramente día con día. Él se dedica a la fabricación y venta de zapatos para ambos generos y todas las edades, gustos y preferencias. Es un hombre muy trabajador el cual se ha  ganado la confianza de sus clientes gracias a su amabilidad y dedicación a la hora de hacer su trabajo. Además las personas lo prefieren ya que el siempre cuenta con variedad de zapatos y con los mejores precios si de zapatos se trata. Su sueño es ver su negocio florecer es decir poder aumentar su nivel de ventas y por consecuencia su nivel de ingresos para poder ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. Es por todo esto que ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el fin de invertir en la materia prima necesaria como: cuero, pega, nylon, y herramientas que le faciliten realizar su trabajo. Todo esto con el objetivo de mantener una mayor variedad de zapatos  que le permitan atraer a más a sus clientes de tal manera que cada día su lista de clientela sea mayor. Le pide a Dios que los resultados de su decisión sean favorables y que le permita cumplir su gran sueño.
texts.en:
36-year-old Elmer Arturo lives in his own home together with his family which consists of his 32-year-old wife and their two children.  Elmer's family mean everything to him and it is for them that he works hard day after day.  His business is making and selling shoes for both sexes and all ages, tastes and preferences.  He is a very hard-working man who has gained the trust of his customers thanks to his kindness and his commitment to his work.  In addition, people prefer to buy from him because he always has a good range of shoes available at the best prices.

Elmer's dream is to see his business flourish.  That is to say, he would like to be able to increase his sales levels, and thereby his income, so that he can offer his family a better quality of life.  For this reason, he has decided to request a loan from INTEGRAL with the aim of investing in the raw materials he needs such as leather, adhesive, nylon, and the tools he needs to carry out his work.  His goal is to have a larger variety of shoes available which will enable him to attract more customers and keep increasing his customer base.  Elmer asks God for favorable results to his decision and to allow him to fulfil his big dream.

loans.use: to buy leather, adhesive, nylon and tools

loans.name: Abateranankunga Group

texts.fr:
Adrien fait partie du groupe Abateranankunga. Le nom du groupe signifie « aider eux même ». Adrien est né au Rwanda. Il est marié avec 6 enfants de 6 à 16 ans, dont 5 scolarisés.

Adrien est cultivateur de riz. C’est son premier cycle de prêt avec ACB. Il va utiliser son crédit afin d’acheter des engrais chimiques et payer la main d’œuvre pour son agriculture de riz. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d’utiliser des engrais chimiques, cultiver peu d’espace et récolter une grande quantité. Dans les prochaines années, Adrien voudrait être parmi les meilleurs cultivateurs de riz dans sa vallée devenir fournisseur de la région. Avec les profits, il prévoit de nourrir ses enfants, les éduquer et s’autofinancer.
texts.en:
Adrien is a member of Abateranankunga Group, which means "helping themselves". He was born in Rwanda. He is married and the father of six children, aged 6 to 16. Five of his children attend school.

Adrien is a rice farmer. This is his first loan cycle with ACB. He will use his loan to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field.

His growth strategy consists in using chemical fertilizers, cultivating a small acreage and yielding a good harvest. In the years to come Adrien would like to become one of the best rice farmers in his valley and become a major supplier in his area. He will use his profit to provide food and education to his children, and to become self-financing.

loans.use: to buy chemical fertilizers and pay for labor to work in his rice field.

loans.name: Oscar Alonso

texts.es:
Oscar tiene 22 años de edad y se dedica en pequeña escala al cultivo de cafe y malanga. Oscar a pesar de ser una persona muy joven ha sabido salir adelante por su propio esfuerzo, desde muy pequeño de edad inició a trabajar en una finca de cafe y al pasar los años fue aprendiendo todo lo referente al manejo del cultivo de cafe. Su situacion economica cambio en el momento que se caso ya que su suegro le dio una parcela de tierra para que la trabajara, asi que Oscar empezo a cultivar cafe y actualmente tambien esta sembrando malanga. El no tiene trabajadores que le ayuden asi que el mismo realiza el cuidado de los cultivos y lo hace todos los dias desde muy temprano por las mañanas. Una de sus desventajas es que la region es propicia para este tipo de cultivos y tiene mucha competencia, pero siempre logra vender toda su produccion.

El prestamo que Oscar esta solitando lo necesita para la compra de fertilizantes e ir tecnificando su finca poco a poco. Con el apoyo del prestamo el producto de sus cultivos seran de mayor calidad.

Su meta es aumentar la produccion y darle una vida digna a su familia. Este es su primer ciclo en FAMA y espera cumplir con el compromiso de sus pagos de forma puntual para que la Organizacion lo siga apoyando con otros prestamos.
texts.en:
Oscar is 22 and has a small coffee and malanga (edible tropical fruit) plantation.  Although he is very young, Oscar has worked hard to get ahead and from a very early age began working on a coffee plantation where he learned all about growing coffee.  His economic situation changed as soon as he got married since his father-in-law gave him his own patch of land.  Oscar began growing coffee and now also grows malanga.  He has no hired help so he is the only one who cares for the crops, which he does every day from very early in the morning.  One of the disadvantages of the region is that it's very good for this type of crop so there is a lot of competition, but he does manage to sell all of his production.

The loan Oscar is requesting will be used to buy fertilizer and to begin adapting his land technologically little by little.  With the help of the loan his crops will be of better quality.

His goal is to increase production and give his family a better lifestyle.  This is his first term in FAMA and he is committed to paying back the loan on time so the organization will continue helping him with future loans.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Zénabou

texts.fr:
Zénabou est une femme  âgé(e) de 25 ans. Elle est mariée å un  électricien. Elle a 01 enfant.
Zénabou travaille comme restauratrice depuis 2008 à Bé. Elle est reconnue par son talent culinaire. Zénabou a de nombreux clients qui viennent de part et d’autres de la ville pour manger chez elle.
Zénabou a requis son premier crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des produits alimentaires et de la boisson. 
Dans les prochaines années. Elle prévoit  avoir une famille heureuse et acheter un terrain avec les profits réalisés.
texts.en:
Zénabou, aged 25, is married to an electrician and the mother of one child. She has been running a restaurant in Bé since 2008. She is well known for her culinary talent. She has many customers who come from various neighborhoods in town to her place and have a meal. Zénabou came to the microfinance institution WAGES and applied for her first loan in order to buy ingredients for her dishes and beverages.

In the years to come Zénabou wants to have a happy family. She intends to use her profit to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy soap, spaghetti, sugar and beverages.

loans.name: Cerro Verde Group

texts.es:
El comité  “Cerro Verde, se conformo con la iniciativa de la señora Limpia. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo, con 11 integrantes. El grupo empezó, demostrando unión y solidaridad entre las compañeras; son muy trabajadoras. A través del Comité ellas quieren lograr una vida digna para sus familias. Todas ellas son mujeres muy sacrificadas y de escasos recursos.
Maria, es una de las miembros, ella tiene una peluquería, la cual explota desde hace ya un buen tiempo, tiene muy variada clientela que siempre acuden a ella, ya sea hombres y mujeres. Tiene buen ingreso, lo que le ayuda a poder cubrir los gastos del negocio y de su casa. Le gustaría poder continuar con su negocio, por lo cual solicita el préstamo a la fundación, es decir para la compra de tijeras, gel, tintes, y algunos químicos necesarios para la peluquería, con lo que podrá surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Cerro Verde was formed through the initiative of Señora Limpia. Currently they are in their 1st loan cycle with 11 members. When the group started it demonstrated unity and solidarity between the members; they are very hardworking. Through the Comité, they want a decent life for their families. They are all self-sacrificing women of limited means.

Maria is one of the members. She has a hairdressing salon which she has run for a very long time. She has a varied clientele which are loyal to her, whether they be men or women. She has a good income which helps her cover both business and household expenses. She would like to continue with her business and for this reason she is asking the Fundacion for a loan to buy scissors, dyes, gel, and chemicals necessary for a hairdressing salon, so as to stock her business.

loans.use: to buy scissors, dyes, gels  and more.

loans.name: Samson Otieno

texts.en: Samson is a 23-year-old single man. He describes himself to be kind, honest, and motivated. He operates a retail shop where he sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, beverages, detergents etc. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His primary customers are the local people. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to increase his stock of items. His business goal is to grow into wholesale within 5 years.

loans.use: To increase his stock of items

loans.name: Sobirzhon

texts.ru: Собиржон занимается продажей масел. Он женат и любящий отец одного ребенка. Его жена домохозяйка и присматривает за ребенком, а он обеспечивает семью. Он работает усердно для того чтобы содержать свою семью в хороших условиях,  с этой целью он открыл свой бизнес. Сперва он продавал рыбу, а потом открыл еще точку для продажи масла. Он продает рыбу сезонно. Он хотел бы получить займ для покупки разных сортов масла и расширения бизнеса. Заранее  благодарит всех кредиторов за их поддержку и милосердие.
texts.en: Sobirzhon sells cooking oil. He is married and a loving father of a child. His wife stays at home and takes care of their child, while Sobirzhon provides for the family. He is working hard to make sure his family has a good life and for this purpose he has started a business. Originally he was selling fish and now he also opened a market stall which sells cooking oil, as he only sells fish when it's in season. Sobirzhon would like to take out a loan to purchase many different types of cooking oils and so to expand his inventory. He would like to thank all of his lenders in advance for their support and charity.

loans.use: to purchase goods

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with seven children. 

Eva has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks, and beverages. She has had this business for 10 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages.

Eva has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Eva hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
La señora María Isabel tiene  cuarenta años de edad es una señora trabajadora, humilde con ganas de salir adelante.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor Brigido quien se dedica a la venta de maíz desde hace tres años  esta muy orgulloso de su esposa ya que doña María siempre a demostrado ser una señora trabajadora con las garras  de enfrentarse a la vida.
Ella se dedica  a la venta de comida desde hace cinco años vente lo que es tacos dorados, caldo  de pescado, caldo de pollo, caldo  de res.
Ella nos cuenta que lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es cocinar para sus clientes y darles un buen servicio para que se vayan con ganas de volver.
Pidió el préstamo para comprar ingredientes para la elaboración de comida: chile verde, Chile  seco, cebolla, manteca, carnes, maíz para la elaboración de tortillas y verduras.

Le da las gracias a fundación por el apoyo que le ha dado para seguir  con una de las cosas que mas quiere que es  su negocio.
texts.en:
Señora María Isabel is 40 years old. She is a humble, hard-working woman with the desire to advance. She is happily married to Señor Brigido, who has been working in corn sales for three years. He is very proud of his wife, since Doña Maria has always shown herself to be a hard-working woman with the will to confront life.

Maria has been selling food for five years. She sells hard-shell tacos, fish soup, chicken soup, and beef soup. She tells us that what she likes best about her business is cooking for her customers and giving them good service so that they leave with the desire to come back. She is asking for the loan to buy ingredients to prepare her food: green chiles, dried chiles, onions, lard, meats, corn to prepare tortillas, and vegetables.

She gives thanks to the foundation for the support they have given her to continue with one of the things that she loves most, which is her business.

loans.use: to buy chiles, onions, tomatoes, etc. to prepare food.

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena is 57 years old.  She is a widow and has one child.

Lucena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store (general store) in the Philippines and has been in business for six years.  She also earns additional income from fattening pigs. 

Lucena is requesting a loan of 19,500 PHP through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her sari-sari store.  She has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF prior to requesting this loan. 

Lucena aspires to save money and expand her business.

loans.use: To buy additional items to sell.

loans.name: Naro

texts.en:
Naro, age 35, is a farmer. His wife, Da, age 36, is a traditional singer. They have been married since 1997 and have two children: one son and one daughter.  The family lives on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Naro is hired to farm and gets paid with fees. He wants to launch his own farming business by himself, but he does not have capital. Therefore, he is requesting his first loan in the amount of $1,200 to buys seed, fertilizer and pesticide and to buy a water pumping machine to spray his farm.

loans.use: to buys seed, fertilizer and pesticides and to buy a water pumping machine to spray his farm.

loans.name: Moris

texts.en: Moris is a thirty-year-old married man with two children living in Kasese, Uganda. His personal goals are educating his children, building a permanent house and self-education. He has been a liquor dealer for the last two years. The major hardships are price fluctuations, inflation, customers not paying on time and high fuel and transportation costs. However, he has a vision of buying land to grow crops. The purpose of the loan is to buy alcohol to sell.

loans.use: to buy alcohol to sell.

loans.name: Sovann

texts.en: Sovann, 47, is widowed and resides with one school-aged child in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. She has been running a business selling all kinds of drinks in the market for over ten years and is successful in her career. In order to increase her income, Sovann is requesting a loan of US $1,000 to purchase more drinks to sell in order to generate more profit to support the family.  In the future, she would like to expand her business, renovate her house and support her child to study at higher levels.

loans.use: to purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Leana

texts.en:
Leana is 52 years old and married with one child who is in school. Leana works very hard to provide for them.

Leana runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Leana has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, shampoo, noodles and other groceries. 

In the future Leana would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell so as to expand her business

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
El señor Armando vive con su esposa y sus hijos en su vivienda en una aldea de Peña Blanca, su actividad es la mecanica automotriz desde hace 15 años. Es un hombre muy emprendedor y dedicado a su negocio.
Don Armando el préstamo lo necesita para invertirlo en la compra de laminas, canaletas, etc. para mejorar su vivienda poco a poco y con mucha ilusión va ir construyendo, piensa ir por partes ahorita sus planes son techarla usando canaletas por más duraderas y laminas de cinc y luego piensa avanzar con el piso, puertas y ventanas.      
Su sueño es mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia.

Peña Blanca, Honduras – Noviembre del 2015

loans.use: para la compra de laminas, canaletas, etc. para su casa.

loans.name: Salum

texts.en: Salum is married with two children.He lives in Vituka area of Dar es Salaam where he owns a small shop in Tandika market in which he sells new imported clothes. He has been in this business for more than six years. He had training in entrepreneurship and small business management offered by Youth Self Employment (YOSEFO). To meet the rising demand for his clothing, he is planning to open another shop adjacent of the current one. The current shop has a small displaying surface, making it difficult to display all samples of clothes in stock. The new shop will help him keep enough stock of clothes so that he will no longer go out of stock on a frequent basis and add the display surface he needs.

loans.use: ADDING STOCK OF CLOTHES

loans.name: Mahshooqa

texts.en:
Mahshooqa is a married woman with four children who is asking for a loan for her husband. She manages the cash for their bicycle repair shop and takes part in cleaning the bicycle parts. They work hard to make their life better. They want to expand their business by getting a loan.

Note: The picture featured in this business profile is the husband of the female entrepreneur, Mahshooqa. In Afghanistan, it is culturally unacceptable to post a picture of a woman on the Internet, but the loan is to the female entrepreneur.

loans.use: Mahshooqa would like to buy more parts to repair bicylces

loans.name: Soké

texts.fr:
Born in 1986 in Tsevie, Ms. K. Soke quit her studies after middle school because she could not afford it any longer and began to learn how to sew. Single, and without any children, she still has the large responsability of caring for her parents and one of her younger sisters. The small earnings she makes in her poorly equipped workplace, are not enough to cover the household needs. However, through her dynamism and impeccable work, she has successfully managed to repay her previous two loans without any problems.

To respond to her clients' demands, Ms K. Soke needs to better equipe her workplace. This is why she is asking for a loan of $850.00, which she will use to purchase sewing machines and fabrics; to make the clothing articles she will then sell. This activity will increase her earnings and improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from French by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Née en 1986 à Tsévié, Mlle K. Soké a arrêté ses études après le collège par manque de support financier et a appris la couture. Célibataire sans enfant, elle a quand même une lourde responsabilité qui est la charge de ses parents et une de ses sœurs. Les maigres revenus de son atelier de couture très peu équipé ne suffisent pas à couvrir les charges du foyer. Mais par son dynamisme et son travail impeccable, elle a su gérer les deux crédits antérieurs sans incident. Pour répondre aux exigences de sa clientèle et la maintenir, Mlle K. Soké a besoin de mieux s’équiper. C’est ainsi qu’elle sollicite un crédit de $850 qui servira à acheter d’autres machines à coudre et des tissus pour confectionner des habits prêt-à-porter pour la commercialisation. Ce qui augmentera ses revenus afin d’améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: To purchase sewing machines and fabrics, to make clothing.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia was born thirty five years ago; she is married with three children. She is an active member of Kahumbu Kwirera Women Group. Cecilia is a farmer who specializes in cereal selling, growing food crops and dairy farming. Out of her milk production she is able to sell 5 liters per day to the Kenya Creameries Cooperative and from the crops she grows, she is able to provide domestically and left with little to sell. She is making an application of Usd 750 to boost her cereal businesses. She intends to buy beans, maize, cowpeas, black peas and green grams, which in turn will increase her customer turn out and profits. She is willing to repay her loan on monthly installments.

loans.use: Cecilia would like to buy varieties of cereals for her cereal shop

loans.name: Malakhat

texts.en: Malakhat, 50 is a mother of four children and lives in Khudat town, in the Khachmaz region. Malakhat pickles tomato,cucumber etc. She has been in this business for a year. She is now requesting a loan of $1,200 to buy vegetables, jars to improve her business and get more income.

loans.use: To buy vegetables, jars

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed A. lives in Beylagan, a small city in southwestern Azerbaijan. He is 30 years old, married and has one daughter. Ahmed sells fruits and vegetables in the Beylagan city bazaar. He started his business six years ago and works very hard to improve his business and his family's standard of living. He is requesting a loan fo $1000 to purchase more stock. This will allow him to service more customers and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a single mother of a two year old boy.  She sells silver-plated jewelery by catalog to the women of her community.   Every weekend she goes to Santo Domingo, the capital, to get the goods that her customers ordered during the week.  After two years she has a well established clientele.

Cristina expects in a few years to have her an own location where she can run her business.  With her loan she will buy more jewelery and some women’s blouses to add to her selection and increase her sales.  Cristina hopes she will increase her income so that she can better care for her unique son.

loans.use: Purchase jewelery and other goods to add to a small business.

loans.name: Asalia

texts.es:
Asalia belongs to the group, Women with a Future, located in Jr. Ruperto Perez 227, in the district of Yarina Cocha, in the state of Ucayali. She is 47 years old and has 4 kids who all depend on her. She is separated. With the first loan of $3000 that she received from Manuela Ramos she invested in used clothes.

She now sells a variety of merchandise such as clothes, shoes, earrings, sandals etc. She normally gets up at 6am to open her store, and she works with clients all day long.

With a loan of $1,100, which she will pay back in 5 months, she will buy new and second hand clothes, such as t-shirts, polo shirts, trousers, dresses, tops, shorts, underwear etc, in all sizes and styles.

Asalia feels good about the business that she has managed to consolidate, and thanks to this she can support her kids' studies. She is very grateful for the support that Manuela Ramos shows her.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Asalia pertenece al banco comunal Mujeres con Futuro, ubicado en Jr. Ruperto Pérez 227, distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 47 años y es madre de 4 hijos que aún dependen de ella y es separada. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en la compra y venta de ropas usadas. En la actualidad se dedica a la venta de una variada gama de mercaderías como ropas, zapatos, aretes, correas, sandalias, etc. Usualmente se levanta a las 6 a.m. para abrir su establecimiento y durante todo el día se dedica a la atención al público. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,100, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de ropas de primera y segunda, tales como camisas, polos, pantalones, vestidos, blusas, short, ropa interior, etc., en todas las tallas y modelos. Asalia se siente bien por el negocio que ha podido consolidar, gracias a ello puede apoyar en los estudios a sus hijos, también se siente muy agradecida al apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To buy clothes / Compra de ropa

loans.name: Rahim

texts.ru:
Rahim Dzhuraboyevich M., 49, lives in Jomi district. He has a secondary school education and is married with seven children. He is an enterpreneur specializing in livestock. He buys calves cheaply and sells them back at the same markets for higher prices one week later. Trading in livestock allows Rahim to support his family; this business is their only source of income. This activity also supplies the local markets with meat at accessible prices. Rahim has been raising and selling livestock for 15 years. He plans to repay his loan within a year.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva volunteer.

Махмаджанов Рахим Джурабоевич житель района Джоми. Возраст 49 лет. Женат имеет семерых детей. Образование среднее. Занимается предпринимательством в сфере животноводства. Закупает бычков подешевле,через неделю перепродает на тех же рынках.Торговля крупно рогатым скотом позволяет клиенту обеспечивать свою семью, т.к этот бизнес является единственным источником его дохода.Так же торговля КРС позволяет обепечивать рынки мясом по доступным ценам. Занимается клиент этим бизнесом уже 15 лет. Погасить кредит клиент планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: to buy livestock

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: TO PURCHASE MATERIALS NEEDED FOR A SUCCESSFUL HARVEST

loans.name: Abdu's Mwamko Group

texts.en:
Abdu O. , age 27, is single. He has a furniture business that he began 6 years ago. He works from 8am to 6pm daily and has been able to make a monthly profit of around $68.

Abdu has taken one previous loan with Tujijenge Tanzania, Ltd. to increase his capital. He hopes for a new loan to improve his furniture business. Abdu will share this loan with his subgroup members who have stores and salons, a dry cleaning business, and sell snakes and charcoal.

Abdu is the tallest person in the photograph. He is wearing red and is in the back row.

loans.use: to increase on business

loans.name: Soselina

texts.en: Soselina L., 53, is married, the mother of five children and loves gardening. Her husband works in security for a local bank. For the last two years, L. has run a flower shop. She sells to the general public and to people from nearby villages for two days each week. She has no previous loans from SPBD, but projects a weekly net cash flow of about $50.  SPBD loans are Soselina’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. She plans to use this loan to add a small room to her house from which she can sell her flowers.

loans.use: To build a small room from which to sell flowers

loans.name: Martha Del Carmen

texts.es:
In the city of Chinandega in the Bisne market, Mrs. Martha P. works selling various products to her customers: backpacks, underwear, toys, plastic products, etc. She works hard in her store in order to support her family in her humble home.

She is seeking a loan from Ceprodel in order to purchase more merchandise to continue selling in her store. She hopes the loan will be granted so that she can improve her income and continue supporting her family.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer.

En la ciudad de Chinandega, en el Mercado el Bisne, la señora Martha P. se dedica al negocio de venta de productos generales ofreciendo a sus clientes mochilas, fajas, juguetes, productos plásticos, etc. vendidos esforzadamente con el propósito de mantener su humilde hogar al que tiene que mantener.

Hoy en día ella acude a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con el crédito necesario que le permita la compra de su mercadería para continuar con su negocio. Espera confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado y de esta manera mejorará sus ingresos en su sector de habitación.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Rani's Group

texts.en:
Rani baji is married to M. and lives in the city of Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan. She has five children, three of whom are married. Another makes a living driving a donkey cart. Her husband sells utensils, a job he has had for the last five years. Rani has successfully paid back a loan from Asasah (a microfinance institute in Pakistan), and is applying for a new loan to buy more utensils for her husband to sell.

She is making this application with four other people. Abida baji wants a loan to buy a sewing machine. Maqsoodan baji wants a loan to buy more material for her carpet-making business. Rashidan baji wants a loan to buy a buffalo so she can sell its milk. Nazmin baji wants a loan to buy additional inventory for her grocery shop. Shamim baji wants a loan for her small milk-selling business.

This is a group loan. Funds will be distributed among the members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To expand their businesses

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! Magdalena M. is twenty-seven years old. She is married with two children, ages one and five. She also has an additional dependent who lives with her because he is an orphan. In 2004, Magdalena established a business selling traditional African cloth that is used by local women to fashion their traditional outifts, called "vitenge." Magdalena runs her shop with the assistance of one employee and earns monthly profits of 400 USD. She is requesting a loan of 875 USD in order to purchase additional cloth and dye to manufacture this African traditional cloth. In the future, she hopes to make enough profit to open another business.

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of microcredit in Tanzania. The organization is devoted to the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through microfinance as a practical way to achieve the economic and social emancipation of women. Customs and traditions in Tanzania normally make it difficult for women to own land and assets; because of this, they are deemed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support, hence poor access to basic needs and services. When a client needs working capital to buy a specific item, SELFINA buys the equipment for said client and extends a loan to her. The same equipment is then leased back to the client so they can use it while in process of paying back their loan, a process called a sale-and-leaseback arrangement. Once the loan has been repaid, SELFINA transfers the ownership of the equipment to the client. The advantage of microleasing over traditional microfinance loans is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To buy cloth in bulk for her business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is an entrepreneur from Kherson where she sells knitted wear for children in the local Dneprovskyi market. Tatyana is a married mom of two kids, seven and five years old. She manages to balance family and work, effectively managing her time with wisdom and thorough planning. Tatyana has been in this trade for two years. Presently, she has about $2000 invested in her business. Her net profit amounts to $400 a month.

Tatyana is a true venturer. She takes risks and handles challenges with endurance and perseverance. Tatyana pursues success of her business and seeks to see it flourish and thrive. This time Tatyana is requesting a loan of 5000 Grivnas ($US1,075) to re-stock her inventory and generate additional income.

loans.use: To re-stock inventory in her clothing shop.

loans.name: Djekafo (Let's Be Together) Group

texts.fr:
Composé de sept (7) femmes (une veuve et six mariés) les membres du groupe Djèkafo ont en moyenne 44 ans avec 4 enfants. Vivant dans des grandes familles traditionnelles élargies (avec beaux parents, beaux frères, soeurs, nièces, fils, cousins, petits fils etc), ils habitent dans le quartier bamanan kin (quartier bamanan) de kirango sous préfecture de Markala (quatrième région administrative du Mali).
Unies par des liens économique et social, elles ont décidé ensemble d’intégrer l’institution Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leur troisième prêt solidaire (prêt de groupe). Les deux précédents prêts ont été remboursés sans difficulté.
Elles comptent acheter, 16 paniers de poisson et 5 sacs de condiments alimentaires composés d’oignon, des choux pommés, du piment et du gombo. Elles s’approvisionnent en poisson au bord du fleuve Niger à kirango auprès des pêcheurs. Quant aux condiments elles se ravitaillent auprès des forains fréquentant les marchés de NioN. et de Sikasso une fois par semaine (chaque dimanche) dans la foire hebdomadaire de Diamarabougou Markala. Les produits ainsi achetés sont ensuite vendus au marché journalier de Kirango Markala à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes.
Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice moyen de 16.000FCFA par mois qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour aider à la prise en charge des dépenses de la famille et des soins de santé des enfants.
 NB : la 7ème femme du groupe la nommée Fatoumata B. ayant perdu son mari est dans la chambre de veuvage donc absente sur la photo de groupe.
texts.en:
Made up of 7 women (a widow and 6 married women), the members of Djèkafo group have an average age of 44 and, on average, 4 children. Living in big traditional extended families (with parents-in-law, brothers- and sisters-in-law, nieces, sons, cousins, grandsons, etc.) they have homes in the Bamanan Kin neighborhood of Kirango, Sous-préfecture of Markala (fourth administrative region of Mali).

United by bonds of both economic and social nature, they have decided to become members of the institution Soro Yiriwaso with whom they are currently on their third group (solidarity) loan. The two preceding ones were reimbursed without difficulty.

They intend to buy 16 baskets of fish and 5 sacks of condiments including onions, cabbage, hot peppers, and okra. They get their fish along the Niger River in Kirango, direct from the fishermen. As for the condiments, they buy them from merchants who come to the markets at NioN. and Sikasso once a week (every Sunday) in the weekly fair of Diamarabougou Markala. The products bought there are re-sold at the daily market of Kirango Markala to a clientele composed mainly of women.

They expect to make an average monthly profit of 16,000 F CFA which they will use essentially to help with family expenses and healthcare for their children. Please note: the 7th woman in the group, Fatoumata B., who has recently lost her husband, has withdrawn for her period of mourning and is thus absent from the group photo.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy fish and condiments for re-sale

loans.name: Anita

texts.en: Anita J. lives with her husband, Mr. Jems J., in the town of Tikhidewal, Lalitpur. Both husband and wife are engaged in herbal medicine. They opened their shop nine months ago. They sell Ram Dev medicine in their store. Ram Dev is one of the most popular gurus of India who teaches yoga. Now Mrs. J. is requesting a loan in the amount of Rs. 10000.00 to buy necessary herbal medicines for their shop.

loans.use: To buy necessary herbal medicines for re-sale

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice sells notebooks and textbooks. Alice is 44 years old and married with 6 children. Alice is determined to eradicate the poverty situation that has engulfed her family. Alice lives in Ibiye, Lagos state, Nigeria. She needs the loan to purchase more notebooks and textbooks to sell. She says thank you to LAPO Microfinance and Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more textbooks and notebooks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm products to make more meals to resell

loans.name: Dasola

texts.en: Dasola A. is 32 years old and married with 3 children. She sells drinks and pepper soup. She makes a lot of profit from this business. She needs the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Narmina

texts.en: Narmina M. is 25 years old and full of enthusiasm and energy. She has been breeding cattle for the last two years, ever since her mother's illness required that she take over the family chores. She tries her best to raise and fatten the calves with the hopes she'll make enough income to cover the basic needs of her old parents. Narmina would like to expand her herd by purchasing two baby calves and fodder for the cattle. She has applied for a 1200 USD loan. The loan will help increase her income and bring financial stability to her family.

loans.use: Purchase two baby calves and fodder

loans.name: Mao

texts.en:
Y. is 49 years old and a resident of Phnom Penh. She is a mother of seven children. Four of her children are married and live independently, two others work in a garment factory, and the youngest one is a student. 

Y. is a widow. She has been serving porridge and rice for breakfast to her neighborhood from her house since 2005. She is a capable mother and a responsible neighbor. She gets up every early morning to prepare her food to sell. She is famous because she is good at making a tasty porridge with pork and grilled meat. 

She has earned a good profit from her business. She wants to build a small shop that provides meals for the whole day so that she can increase her income and prepare for the wedding of her next child. Y. is taking a loan of $1000 to build a small shop for her business. The loan will help the family attain a better standard of living.

loans.use: To build a small shop for her business

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
El señor Basilio M. tiene 40 años de edad, esta casado desde hace mucho tiempo con la señora Santa Lopez y viven en su casa propia, que esta situada en el Barrio Santa Rosa Guaviyu de San Juan del Parana. Ellos tienen tres hijos pequeños que aun dependen economicamente de los padres.

El señor Basilio junto con su esposa se dedican desde hace tiempo a la fabricacion de remeras para los estudiantes de los colegios de la zona y tambien para distribuir a vendedores ambulantes y comercios de la ciudad de Encarnacion. Gracias a este trabajo ellos pueden mantener su hogar y cubrir todas las necesidades que en el se presenten.

Ellos hoy dia estan solicitando el credito para la compra de una Maquina Collareta que les resulta necesario para mejorar la terminacion de sus prendas, ya que esta levantando mas pedidos de otras Escuelas y necesita tener los elementos necesarios. El monto que solicitan es de Gs. 2.000.000.
texts.en:
Mr. Basilio M. is 40 years old and has been married to Mrs. Santa Lopez for a long time. They live in their own home in the Santa Rosa Guaviyu neighborhood of San Juan de Parana. They have three small children who they still support financially. Basilio and his wife have been making t-shirts for some time now; they distribute the shirts to local schoolchildren, traveling salespeople and businesses in the city of Encarnacion. Thanks to this work, the couple is able to support their family and pay for any needs that arise. The couple is requesting this loan to buy a sewing machine so that they can do a better job finishing each item. They are receiving more and more T-shirt orders from other schools, so they need to have all the necessary implements to work with. They are requesting a loan of 2,000,000 guaraníes (US$400).

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mirsharif

texts.ru: Миршарифу 37 лет. Женат и имеет 3-х детей. Образование у него среднее. Он кредитуется у нас 1 год. С прошлого года у него увеличилось количество скота. Жена - домохозяйка. В феврале Миршариф купил своей жене дойную корову. Жена была очень рада этому, потому, что молоко, которое она доила, хватало для семьи и еще она могла продавать. Но молока, которое дает одна корова, не так уж и много чтобы получать от нее хорошей прибыли. Она попросила мужа купить ей еще одну дойную корову. Теперь за этот займ Миршариф собирается купить жене еще одну корову.
texts.en:
Mirsharif is 37 years old. He is married and has 3 children. Mirsharif has a high school education. He has been our borrower for 1 year. Since last year his livestock headcount has increased. His wife is a homemaker. In February Mirsharif bought a dairy cow for his wife. His wife was very happy about this, because the milk that she got from the cow was enough for the family and she was also able to sell some of it. But one cow does not produce that much milk to earn good profits. She asked her husband to buy her another dairy cow. Now, using this loan Mirsharif plans to buy his wife one more cow.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dairy cow

loans.name: Channa

texts.en:
Mrs. Channa S. is a farmer in Sophy village in Takeo province. She owns a plot of land where she cultivates rice. Her husband, Mr. Nget Thy, is a construction worker. Aside from this work, he is a palm juice collector. Although they try to work hard, they still earn too little income to support their family.

In order to improve their living standard, Mrs. Channa S. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy two cows for breeding and to reduce her expense for plowing the field. She is 36 years old and the mother of two children who are too young to work or study. She and her husband are both in the picture.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy two cows for breeding

loans.name: Sakina Sameer Khan Group

texts.en:
Zareena wants a loan to buy cigarettes to resell. Seema wants a loan to buy groceries for her grocery shop. Asia, Anufe and Reshma want loans to buy buffaloes for their dairy business. Sakina has lived in Kot Radha Kishan, Pakistan for the past 15 years. Her husband runs a dairy business. Presently, they have one buffalo and Sakina takes care of it. Sakina is the group leader and is applying for a loan to buy another buffalo for her husband's dairy business.

This is a group loan. Funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members guarantee one another's loans. If one does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: Buy another buffalo for the dairy business.

loans.name: Mairam

texts.en:
T. Mairam is an enterprising, capable, and very hard-working woman. She lives in Shahrituz, Tajikistan and sells shoes for women and children. She began her business after the death of her husband. Her work is allowing her three children to go to school. It is very important to Dilorom that her children finish school and become honest, hard-working individuals. You can help Dilorom provide for the education of her children. She needs 5000 Somoni to buy merchandise to increase sales. She wants to continue to support her children and only wishes to work in order to achieve this. Support her! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing of the new shoes for women for summer season.

loans.name: Augusta

texts.en:
Augusta is 56 years old, married and has four children between the ages of 19 and 29. She is originally from Inhambine, located on the central coast of Mozambique, but moved to Maputo in 1987 when her husband was transferred there for work. 

Augusta graduated from high school and began her studies in economics at the university level, but was forced to leave after her second year in order to take care of her children. Since 1997 she has had a business selling used clothes, charcoal and beverages and currently employs two assistants. Her most popular products are soft drinks and beer, which she buys wholesale and sells at retail prices. 

Augusta has previously taken out loans with the organization GTZ; this will be her first loan with Hluvuku, a Kiva partner. She intends to use this loan to increase her business' inventory to meet the demands of her clientele. In the near future, she would like to open a second point of sale for her business in order to increase profits. She currently is working out of a stall, but dreams of opening a store of her own.

loans.use: Increased retail stock

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth tailors clothes and also sells tailoring materials. She hopes for the loan of N140,000 to purchase a weaving machine. She is 44 years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a weaving machine

loans.name: Jeffer Omar

texts.es: El joven Jeffer Omar, empezó a trabajar en la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de cosméticos para obtener ingresos ya que tiene una familia y desea salir adelante, su esposa le tiene una niña de 4 años de edad. Tiene 22 años de edad, reside en la comunidad Ciudad Sandino en la capital de Managua, tiene tres años de administrar este negocio. Este es su primer crédito en Afodenic el cual quiere invertir en la comprar de carteras, zapatos, y ropa para vender variedad a sus clientes. A futuro espera crecer en inventario y tener mejores utilidades y poder ahorrar para poder comprar su propia casa.
texts.en:
The young man Jeffer Omar began working in the sales of clothes, shoes and cosmetic products to earn income since he has a family and wishes to get ahead. His wife has a 4 year old little girl. He is 22 years old, and lives in the community Sandino City in the capital of Managua. He has been managing this business for three years. This is his first loan with Afodenic, and he wants to invest it in the purchase of purses, shoes and clothing in order to sell a variety to his customers. In the future, he hopes to grow his inventory and have greater profits, and to be able to save in order to be able to buy his own home.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothes, shoes, and purses

loans.name: Iman Group

texts.en:
Jaquiline is a member of the Iman borrower group in Msamvu,Morogoro,she is 42 years old woman,she is married and a mother of 1 child.Her child is aged 8 years.

Jaquiline started her own tailoring business 15 years ago,she works 12 hours a day and earn monthly profit approximately 250,000 Tanzania shillings.

This is Jaquline second loan from BRAC_Tanzania,she requested the amount of 500,000 Tsh in order to buy more materials for her business.

With the additional profit she gains from the use of this loan,Jaquline hopes to save money and expand her business.

Beatrice,Monica are also the member of the same borrower group,they requested loan amount 400,000Tsh and 500,000Tsh respectively in order to expand their business.

loans.use: To buy more materials

loans.name: Donato

texts.es: LA SEÑOR DONATO Q. TIENE LA ACTIVIDAD DE CONFECCION DE CHAMARRAS Y SACONES PARA DAMAS DE DIFERENTES TALLAS. EL SEÑOR ES VIUDO TIENE DOS HIJAS, QUE AUN ESTAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR, PESE A ESO LE COLABORAN CON LA CONFECCION. REQUIERE EL CREDITO PARA COMPRAR UNA MAQUINA DE COSER DE MEDIO USO, ASI TENER MAYOR MARGEN DE GANANCIA.
texts.en:
Mr. Donato Q. is in the business of making jackets and coats for women of various sizes. He is a widower and has two daughters, who are still school-aged and thus help him with clothing production. He requests a loan for the purchase of a used sewing machine, which will improve his profit margin.

Translated from Spanish by Amanda McDermott, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase a used sewing machine

loans.name: Eugénie

texts.fr: F. Eugénie est née vers 1957 à Grand-Popo. Eugénie est mariée à EZIN Sébastien, un agent retrait de l’Office des Postes et Télécommunication du Bénin. Ce couple a à sa charge quatre enfants tous scolarisés dont deux sont les leurs. La famille réside depuis dix sept ans à Fridjrossè Kpota, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. C’est le mari d'Eugénie qui assure les charges de la famille. Eugénie vend de la farine de blé et du sucre en poudre en mesure d’un kilogramme qu’elle attache dans des sachets, de l’huile d’arachide ; elle vend aussi de la bouillie de maïs et des beignets. C’est à Dantokpa, grand marché international du Bénin que Eugénie achète ses produits et elle les vend devant chez elle à la maison. Eugénie a déjà onze ans d’expérience dans cette activité. Eugénie a déjà eu deux crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Eugénie demande un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
F. Eugénie was born around 1957 in Grand-Popo.  She is married to EZIN Sébastien, a retired representative of the Office des Postes et Télécommunication du Bénin.  This couple has four children to support.  Two of them are their own; all four are in school.  For 6 or 7 years, the family has been residing in Fridjrossè Kpota, a district of Cotonou.  Eugénie's husband is the one who ensure that family expenses are covered.  Eugénie sells wheat flour and sugar in bags by the kilo;  she also sells peanut oil, cornmeal porridge, and beignets. Dantokpa, the grand international marketplace of Benin, is where Eugénie purchases her goods, which she sells in front of her house.  She already has 11 years of experience in this business.  She had two ALIDé loans before that she has repaid.  She was able to use them to raise her level of business.  To continue to develop her business, Eugénie is asking for a third loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of corn and wheat flour

loans.name: Violet

texts.en: Violet N. is a 38 year old married, polite, woman, who is blessed with seven children. She says her family is a big family, thus it takes more than a retail shop to take care of every one of its needs. That is why she dropped her first business, a retail shop, to venture into the farm produce business. She says from this it was possible to kill two birds with one stone: both feed her family and sell some of the produce to earn income. Violet requires a loan of Kshs. 10,000 to prepare for the oncoming rainy season. She says she will use this to prepare her vast land and get fertilizer, seeds and hire labor to help prepare in time for the rains. Her future ambition is to one day be able to build rental houses from the income she gets from the farm produce sales.

loans.use: Hire farm labor, prepare land, and buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda D., 44 years old, is a rice grower in Kapatungan, Trento, Agusan Del Sur. She learned all the farming work from her parents and husband. She dreams that someday she will be able to grow her harvest to support the growing needs of their family. The income she makes from growing rice is what she uses to pay the daily expenses in their family including food, clothes and other basic needs.

Merlinda would like to apply for a loan of Php 8,000 from Community Economic Ventures Inc. (CEVI). She will use the loan to finance her business by buying all the farming necessities. She chose CEVI because, aside from the 2% interest rate, it also provides insurance coverage to all its clients.

loans.use: To use for farm financing

loans.name: Phom

texts.en: S. is  25, married and the mother of one lovely young child. She owns a small rattan-selling business. She always collects to buy rattan cupboard in bulk from her nearby neighbors and then takes it to sell door-to-door in the community. Her husband assists with her in selling the produce. S. faces difficulty with transporting her items to sell, because she doesn’t have her own vehicle. Therefore, S. has decided to ask a loan from Kiva’s partner HKL in order to purchase a trailer and a motorcycle, which she will use as transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a trailer which she will use as transportation

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a 45 year old trader. She is married and has three children who are currently in school. She sells used clothing and has been in this business for the past 10 years. With low capital, she is not able to buy larger quantities of used clothes to sell. Therefore she is requesting a loan to buy a larger variety of used clothing in order to increase her stock. She hopes to use part of her proceeds to support her children’s education. She desires to expand her business and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase assorted used clothes in bulk.

loans.name: Gusman

texts.es:
Gusman es chofer asalariado en el grupo de trufis 88 del Sindicato Eduardo Abaroa; trabaja dos años en el mencionado sindicato.
 
Vive en la casa de sus padres ubicado en la zona Pazanqueri  Provincia murillo de la ciudad de La Paz. 

Su esposa le colabora con el cuidado de su hogar y de su hijo el cual esta en etapa escolar.

  El crédito lo destinará para compra de material de construcción, por que hará construir una habitación donde vivirá con su familia.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Gusman is a salaried driver for the shared commuter cars called Group 88, with the Eduardo Abaroa Syndicate. He has worked for this syndicate for two years. He lives in his parents house located in the Pazanqueri Provincia Murillo area in the city of La Paz. His wife helps with the upkeep of the home and their son who is school age. The loan will be designated for the purchase of construction materials for a room to be built where he will live with his family. This first loan with field partner Impro, with this completed evaluation they qualified for the granting of the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Andrea Kellogg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bricks, cement, stucco and other materials in order to build a room.

loans.name: Yamileth De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
En el departamento de León, específicamente en el municipio de Nagarote, la señora Yamileth de los Angeles P. ha sido cliente de Ceprodel quien le ha ayudado a mejorar las condiciones de su negocio el cual es la venta de ropa  a la que se dedica desde hace 13 años siendo este el negocio que le permite obtener los ingresos para mantener a su familia y apoyar al estudio de dos hijos en edad escolar

Ella está comprometida con su familia a mejorar cada vez el negocio y para ello solicita un crédito en Ceprodel para utilizarlo en la compra de la ropa tanto para caballeros, damas y niños para continuar ofreciéndola en su localidad.
texts.en:
In the geographic state called Léon, specifically in the Nagarote municipality, Mrs. Yamileth de los Angeles P. has been a Ceprodel client who has helped improved the conditions of her business. She has been selling clothing for 13 years, and this business enables her to obtain income to support her family and her two school-aged children’s education. She has promised to her family to continuously improve her business so she is seeking a loan from Ceprodel to use to buy clothing for men, women and children in order to continue selling it in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: Momoe

texts.en:
Momoe S. is 25 and married with 1 child (11 monthsold).  She owns a business venture, planting & harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Momoe has 3 years of experience in this business.  Momoe needs a loan of WST $1000 to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.  She plans to use the earnings from her business (estimated to be 100 tala or US $42 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2009, Momoe joined SPBD.    This is her 1st loan with SPBD.   SPBD's loans are Momoe's only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.

The following social metrics for Momoe S. are provided by SPBD*:
Overall Social Metric Score:                1.87 out of 3
Level of Education:                              2.12 out of 3
Level of total Household Income:         2 out of 3
Quality of Household Assets:              1.52 out of 3

*SPBD measures the living conditions of each of its borrowers to track her loan progress. The overall social metric score, provided by SPBD, is based upon a number of factors, such as the condition of the house/household assets, health, education, income level, and family reputation. A higher number represents a higher score. For example, a ""3 out of 3"" on education would mean that the borrower has graduated from university; a ""2 out of 3"" = secondary/high-school, and a ""1 out of 3"" would mean that the borrower is uneducated.

For more information on this score, please see SPBD's partner page at: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=15

About SPBD
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD and since then, it has expanded from the main island of Upolu in Samoa to Savaii, as well as Tonga. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based upon the Grameen Bank lending method.

Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD: http://www.kiva.org/community/viewTeam?team_id=8375

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Christine

texts.fr: Née en 1977 à Akpro-Missérété dans le département de l’Ouémé, K. Christine vit depuis sept ans à Agbalilamè à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Mariée à NOUNAGNON Pascal, un chauffeur, Christine est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Christine vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Christine n’a pas fréquenté l’école. Il y a deux ans environs que Christine s’est mise dans la restauration. En effet, pour venir en aide à son mari, Christine vend des bananes frites ainsi que des taros frits, de façon ambulante. Christine s’approvisionne au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Christine a obtenu une fois de crédit auprès de ALIDé, et a bien remboursé ledit crédit. Le stock de produits que vend Christine n’est plus actuellement suffisant pour satisfaire toute sa clientèle. De plus, Christine ne dispose pas suffisamment de moyens financiers pour augmenter le stock de ses produits et mieux satisfaire toute sa clientèle. C’est la raison pour laquelle Christine sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in en 1977 in Akpro-Missérété (Ouémé county), Ms. K. Christine has lived for seven years in Agbalilamè, in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Married to Mr. NOUNAGNON Pascal, a chauffeur, she is the mother of four children, who are all in school. She lives together with her children and husband. The couple jointly ensures that family expenses are covered. Christine never attended school. About two years ago, she got started in food catering. To help out her husband, she basically goes from place to place selling fried bananas, as well as fried taro. She supplies herself at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. She once obtained an ALIDé loan, and she repaid the aforementioned loan. The stock of goods that she sells is no longer enough right now for satisfying all her customers. In addition, she doesn't have the financial means to increase her stock of goods and to do better in satisfying her entire customer base. These are the reasons why Christine is requesting a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying bunches of bananas and some taro

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy cloth

loans.name: Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Maiya B. lives as a single family with her husband and one son. Her son is just a year old. Both Mrs. Malla and Mr. Malla are engaged in agriculture. They own their own land for farming. Mostly they grow green vegetables on their land. They sell their vegetables at the local market in the morning and evening daily. They meet all the needs of their family with their income from farming. 

Mrs. Maiya B. lives in Bhatkepati. Bhatkepati is located in the Kathmandu district and most of the people in this region are engaged in farming. Mrs. B. is requesting a 10,000 Nepalese rupee loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for the farm.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose is a very successful and hard-working woman of 46 who is married with five children. She lives in Lagos where she has had a business selling groceries and drinks for over eight years. She manages the business with the help of her husband. Rose is requesting NGN 140,000 to purchase more groceries and drinks to sell as this will enable her to expand her business and increase her profit. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and drinks to sell.

loans.name: Poni

texts.en:
Poni S. is currently in the business of selling rice, maize and millets at the market. She is requesting a loan to buy more bags of maize and rice to sell. Poni is 49 years old and is married to a police man. She has 5 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize and rice to sell

loans.name: Nar

texts.fr: Nar N. est une femme de 44 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 9 enfants en charge. Elle est membre de Banc Villageois depuis 6 ans et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié 12 fois de suite. Elle fait de l'embouche ovine et son nouveau prêt lui permettra d'acheter 10 moutons qu'elle engraissera pour revendre au bout de 5 mois. Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Nar N. is 44 years old, married and the mother of nine children, all under her care. She has been a member of the local “Banc Villageois” for six years and has acquired a solid experience in credit loans, after being granted 12 successive loans. She fattens sheep and her new loan will enable her to buy ten sheep to fatten and resell after five months. Her objective is to participate in improving her family’s living conditions.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ten sheep for fattening

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.es: LA SRA. FELICIDAD  VIVE EN LA  ZONA VILLA OBRAJES, ES SU CASITA PROPIA, ES CASADA TIENE 5 HIJOS LOS DOS TRABAJAN DURO PARA MANTENER EL HOGAR YA QUE CON 5 HIJOS QUE SE ENCUENTRAN EN EDAD ESCOLAR NO LES ALCANZA EL DINERO, ES DE CLASE HUMILDE Y SENCILLA, ES MUY TRABAJADORA Y SACRIFICADA, SE DEDICA A VENDER COSAS USADAS COMO POR EJEMPLO ROPA Y OTRAS COSAS USADAS QUE COMPRA AVECES VISITANDO CASA POR CASA Y DESPUES LOS VENDE A UN PRECIO MAS ELEVADO, ELLA TIENE SU PUESTOS DE VENTA DONDE COMERCIALIZA SUS PRODUCTOS. EL CREDITO SOLICITA PARA AUMENTO DE CAPITAL PARA PODER COMPRAR MAS MERCADERIA Y SU ESPOSO ES ALBAÑIL TIENE CONTRATOS Y CUANDO NO TIENE TRABAJO CUIDA A SUS HIJITOS, ESTAN MUY AGRADECIDOS CON EMPRENDER Y KIVA QUE LES DA ESTA OPORTUNIDAD EN LA OTORGACION DEL CREDITO.
texts.en:
Felicidad lives in her own little house in the Villa Obrajes zone. She is married and has five children. She and her husband work hard to take care of their home since with five school-age children they don't have enough money. Felicidad comes from humble and simple people. She is very hard-working and self-sacrificing. She sells used things like, for example, clothing and other used things that she buys, sometimes by visiting house to house, and later she sells them at higher prices. She has spots where she sells her products. She is asking for this loan to increase her capital so she can buy more merchandise. Felicidad's husband is a bricklayer. He has contracts, and when he has no work, he takes care of the children. They are both very grateful to Emprender and Kiva, who have given them this opportunity by giving them the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Nelsón

texts.es:
El señor Nelson M.M.es casado tiene 8 Hijos y una Hija, vive en la Compañía Cabañas de la ciudad de Caacupe.
 El  señor Nelson   es muy trabajador  tienen una despensa en su domicilio y también trabaja en un establecimiento ganadero y agrícola.
El tiene cría de ganado vacuno y de cerdo y tiene algunas plantaciones de yuca y otros cultivos de autoconsumo, y al mismo tiempo como tiene tractor realiza trabajos por hora. 
Solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento general de su maquinaria ya que le resulta muy rentable realizar trabajos con el.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo obtenido para su actividad  y mediante ello su negocio está creciendo brindando sus servicios y productos de buena calidad a la comunidad.
texts.en:
Nelson M.M.is married and has 8 sons and one daughter; he lives in Compañía Cabañas, Caacupe. Nelson is very hard working; he has a grocery store in his home and also works for an agricultural and cattle-raising firm. He raises cattle and pigs and has some manioc and other crops for self consumption; he also has a tractor that he uses to provide hourly work. He is requesting funds to provide general maintenance and service for his machinery because it’s quite profitable to do jobs with it. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya for the support given to his activities; thanks to it, his business providing services and quality products to the community has been growing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For tractor maintenance and repair

loans.name: Baltazar

texts.en:
Baltazar M. is a 39 year old married man who supports his family by operating a general store and fish vending business. He lives in Brgy Alijis, Valladolid, Negros Occidental with his 36 year old wife, Nerisa, who helps her husband in managing the business while their 2 children attend school.

He has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved his living conditions with the help of his loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in his general store and with his fish vending business, he is gradually making his family more economically stable. He now earns an average monthly income of Php 10,500.

Baltazar is borrowing Php 12,500 so that he could continue and improve his general store and fish vending business. This will be his 10th cycle loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. His previous loan of Php 9,500, which he paid off well within its term, was just another step in his journey towards economic freedom. Baltazar aspires to elevate his family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ana Isabel

texts.pt:
Ana Isabel Manuel C. nasceu na cidade da Matola, Província de Maputo, sul de Moçambique, solteira e mãe de 2 filhos de 7 e 5 anos de idade, vão a escola. Fez somente 2ą classe não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores mas tem esperança de um dia voltar a escola. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém para além de seus filhos.
Saiu da sua cidade natal para Inhambane a procura de melhores condições de vida, 10 anos depois regressa a cidade da Matola. Tem um negócio próprio de criação de frangos de corte ha mais de 12 anos, não possui nenhum empregado e consegue um rendimento de cerca de 5.000.00mt por mês, que aplica nas despesas e ainda poupa algum na sua conta bancária.
Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de sua irmã que Ja teve empréstimo nesta instituição. Este é o seu 1º empréstimo no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar pintos, rações e vitaminas para aumentar a quantidade do seu stock. 
Compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poder aceder a outros. No futuro pretende solicitar mais empréstimos para ampliar os seus aviários meter mais frangos.
texts.en:
Ana Isabel Manuel C. was born in the city of Matola in the Maputo province, in the south of Mozambique. She is a single mother of two children, who are 7 and 5 years old, and both attend school. She only attended through 2nd grade and did not continue due to her parents' lack of finances. She lives in her own home with her family and she does not support anyone else besides her children.

She left her birth city for Inhambane to pursue better living conditions. Ten years later, she returned to Matola. She has a business raising chickens and has done this for more than 12 years. She doesn't have any employees and earns about 5,000MT monthly, which she applies to her household expenses and still saves some to her bank account.

She has never taken out a loan with another bank. She came to know Hluvuku through her sister who had already received a loan from the institution. This is her first loan for the amount of 25,000MT, which she plans to use to purchase feed and vitamins to increase the quantity of her stock. She promises to repay this loan dutifully to be able to access others. In the future she hopes to seek more loans to expand her aviaries to fit more chickens.

Translated from Portuguese by Michelle Harrison, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of chicken feed and vitamins

loans.name: Omar Abel

texts.es:
el sr. Omar Abel A. se dedica al comercio desde hace unos 8 años es casado y tiene cuatro hijos, todos menores.
Su esposa trabaja en la empacadora Ibermar, juntos aportan dinero para el sustento de su familia.
tienen su propia casa ubicada en la Caucara San Lorenzo, Valle.
el viaja a la frontera del Amatillo todos los dias a vender sus productos como ser: focos de mano, antenas para tv, baterias, rasuradoras desechables, sus ventas son en dolares y es por esta razon que el viaja largo a vender por que le pagan mejor su producto.
 
el credito lo utilizara para comprar mas mercaderia, sus clientes son turistas, camioneros y transportistas.
texts.en:
Omar Abel A. has been in business for the past 8 years, is married with four young children. His wife worker in the Ibermar packing plant, and together they contribute economically to maintaining their family. They have their own home in Caucara San Lorenzo, Valle. He travels daily to the border at Amatillo to sell goods such as: flashlights, tv antennas, batteries and disposable razors. His sales are in dollars which is why he travels so far since he gets better prices for his goods. He will use his loan to buy more merchandise for his clients which are tourists, truckers and drivers.

Translated from Spanish by Solson Scherman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flashlights, TV antennas, razors, toothpaste, motor oil

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married with two children. She is an entrepreneur from Uzhgorod. Olena sells children's clothing in one of the local markets. She launched her business five years ago. Currently, she earns 5,000 UAH of net profit each month. 

Olena is seeking a loan of 10,000 UAH to purchase additional merchandise for her kiosk. She typically will buy inventory wholesale from her suppliers for retail sale. This allows her to maintain an adequate amount of inventory on hand and to easily update her product selection if an item is selling well or not moving quickly enough. The current loan will continue to benefit Olena's business and provide much needed income for her and her family.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise to sell

loans.name: Sous

texts.en: Mr. Sous A. is a 45-year-old mA. and father. He lives with his wife and their four children in their own small family home in Kompong Tom Province. Sous A. owns a piece of land that he inherited from his grandparents. He grows different kinds of crops on his land such as rubber and potato crops. Hi children help with family financial responsibilities by working as requirement laborers. His wife appears on the left of the photo. She works with him in the farm field. Sous A. will be using a loA. he requested to buy a plot of neighbor's farmland, where he will plant new crops for extra income.

loans.use: To buy a plot of neighbor's farmland where he will plant new crops for extra income.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia G., age 59, is married and has two children of working age. Amelia and her husband work hard to cover daily expenses and Amelia has been running her own clothing and tailoring store for more than ten years.

Amelia relies on having a constant supply of fabric and other tailoring materials to keep her business running, and has requested a loan of PHP 20,000 to help her purchase additional inventory. Amelia hopes the additional materials will help her cater to customers' demands on various designs and styles of clothing they want. By so doing, it helps her to expand her business.

Amelia has been a member of the Center for Community Transformation (CCT) since 2006 and has consistently attended weekly fellowship meetings.*  She hopes for a happy and stable life for her family, and would like her business to continue to expand.
