* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase tailoring materials.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson T. Sr. is from the village of Sandiat West. He is 55 years old, married and has 5 school-aged children. Samson owns and operates a business  raising livestock, primarily pigs, for fattening and sale. Samson has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2006, Samson joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Samson has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI, which was used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell in the future. Samson is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Samson from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay his children's tuition fees.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Laura Alexandra

texts.es:
Laura de 28 años, es vendedora de artículos electrónicos,   vive en una zona periurbana caracterizada por sus caminos de tierra y lomas. 

Inicio con su esposo el negocio de los aparatos electrónicos y domésticos hace 5 años atrás con un muy bajo capital compraron microondas, cocinas, ventiladores para venderlos  a sus amigos y conocidos. Poco a poco en el sector donde viven se hicieron muy conocidos. Los dos trabajan turnando su tiempo para poder estar con sus dos hijas. 

Para seguir con su negocio ella quiere comprar televisores y perfumes para venderlos a sus clientes. En el futuro quiere invertir en su casa para construirla mejor.
texts.en:
Laura, age 28, sells electronic appliances. She lives in a peri-urban zone characterized by dirt roads and hills. She started her household and electronic appliances business with her husband 5 years ago. With a little capital, they bought microwaves, stoves, and electric fans to sell to their friends and acquaintances. Bit by bit, they became more well known in the sector where they live. The two take turns working so that they can spend time with their two daughters. To continue developing her business, Laura wants to buy televisions and perfumes to sell to her customers. In the future she wants to invest in improving her house.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Television sets, perfume.

loans.name: Vaisidin

texts.en:
M. Vaisidin is 42 years old. He is married and has five children. His wife is a housewife and the business of Vaisidin is the main source of income for his large family. 

Vaisidin has been providing transportation services for the last 7 years. At the same time he sells construction materials at the market. Vaisidin is dreaming all of his children being well-educated so he is working hard. As a result the business generates significant income allowing him to support his large family. 

In order to provide the better service for his clients and in that way earn more, Vaisidin needs to make major repairs on his lorry. He believes that this will make his business more profitable. With this purpose in mind, he requests 1500 USD. With part of the loan he will also buy construction materials to increase the range of goods he sells.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for the lorry and construction materials

loans.name: Francisco Antonio

texts.es:
Francisco de 52 años, tiene una papelería, vive con su esposa y dos hijos en el Fortín de Guayaquil( zona periurbana, con caminos de tierra y lomas). 

Empezó hace 15 años con su papelería para tener mas ingresos para su familia, desde ese tiempo hasta ahora la papelería ha sido una muy buen fuente de ingresos para soportar la crisis, trabaja desde las 07h00am hasta las 20h00pm todos los días. Tiene a la venta papeles, cuadernos, plumas, shampoo etc.   

El quiere surtir mas su papelería por eso quiere comprar con el  préstamo cuadernos, plumas, papelería. En el futuro quiere aumentar su negocio y readecuarlo.
texts.en:
Francisco is 52 years old and owns a stationary store. He lives with his wife and two children in Fortín de Guayaquil (a semi-urban zone, with dirt roads and hills).

He started the stationary store business 15 years ago to increase his family income. Since that time, the stationary store has been a very good source of income. To tolerate the economic crisis, he works from 7:00am until 8:00pm every day. For sale in his shop are paper, notebooks, pens, shampoo, etc.

He wants to stock up on more items for his shop. As such, with the loan he wants to buy notebooks, pens, and stationary goods. In the future he wants to grow his business and re-stock it.

loans.use: Notebooks, stationary

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
María Auxiliadora es una mujer de edad avanzada, con su propio negocio que inicio hace varios años con dinero que su familia mediante remesas  ah apoyado como los financiamientos Y que gracias a su tenacidad y empeño ha logrado el aumentar su inventario.
Lo que ha logrado invertir no solo en productos de granos básicos, sino que también en cosméticos, perfumes, como otros productos de uso personal.
Con su nuevo préstamo quiere comprar ropa ya que viene la temporada buena, productos Avon, en cosméticos, como frutas, golosinas, carne, pollo, productos lácteos.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora is an elderly woman with her own business which she set up several years ago with money that her family, through remittances, has supported her with, as well as loans.  Thanks to her tenacity and determination she has succeeded in increasing her inventory.

She has managed to invest not only in basic foodstuffs but also in cosmetics, perfumes and other personal use products.

With her new loan she would like to buy clothes since a good season is arriving.  She would also like to buy Avon products, cosmetics, fruit, candies, meat, chicken and dairy products.

loans.use: To invest in clothes, cosmetics, fruit, candies, chicken and meat.  To increase her sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a dairy cow

loans.name: Marko Ekama

texts.en:
Marko Ekama L. is a man of 22 years, married and a father of two beautiful children. His wife Elizabeth Nakiridi Allan has a charcoal business, which adds to the family income together with Marko's motorcycle transport business. They live in Eldoret Town where they operate their separate businesses. Marko gets a monthly income of 9,000 shillings and has been in this business for nine years now.

With this loan, Marko plans to boost the wife's business by buying more charcoal for resale. This will be his first loan from KADET and with the income he is going to get, he plans to buy more charcoal and use the rest of the money to feed his family. In the future, he plans to buy land and build rental houses to increase his family income and to educate his children and send them to the best schools in Eldoret.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal to sell

loans.name: Badamtsetseg

texts.en:
Mrs.Badamtsetseg is 43 years old. She lives with her husband, younger daughter, and granddaughter in "ger," a yurt or traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. 

Since 1999, she has run a shoe business. She buys shoes from wholesalers who bring them from abroad, and she sells them at the Narantuul, the largest outdoor market in the city. She rents two stalls at the market. Her husband, Enkhbat, helps in her business part time and also runs a taxi and delivery business using the family car. Their goal is to accumulate anough money to build a family house in the future and to give a proper education to their children. She has a two daughters. Her older daughter, a university graduate, lives separately with her husband. The younger one is a university student. 

This time of the year, the temperature drops to -25 to -30 degrees Celsius (-13 to -22 degrees Fahrenheit) and winter warm shoes are in big demand. Therefore, she wants to use this loan to increase her working capital and inventory.

loans.use: To increase her working capital and inventory for the winter season

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Sr. Julio Cesar M. es una persona que desde chico aprendió el oficio de hacer unos ricos chicharrones y barbacoa para su venta al publico, desde entonces ha seguido el ramo de este negocio ahora al lado de su esposa e hijos, ya que les ha resultado muy productivo y de esta manera pueden estar juntos como familia mas tiempo, ahora, se quieren expander un poco mas ya que les ha ido aumentando la clientela  solicitando su producto hecho en casa, es por esta razón que el Sr. julio solicita su crédito ya que los anteriores los ha estado liquidando en excelente comportamiento. Y ahora se le presento una oportunidad de comprar más producto para vender y no quiere desaprovecharla.
texts.en:
As a young boy, Mr. Julio Cesar M. learned to make great tasting pork cracklings and barbecue meat. He has been in the business since then and now works with his wife and children.  The business has provided a good income and allowed the family to spend more time together.  

Julio is requesting a loan to increase production since there is much demand for his home-made product.  He has always paid back earlier loans in a timely fashion.  He plans to take advantage of an opportunity he is being given to buy more products so he can increase his customer base.

loans.use: To buy meat for pork cracklings and barbecue

loans.name: Seav

texts.en:
Seav S., 22, is married and resides with her husband and a child in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for Angkorean temples. She is a housewife while her husband is a chef, earning an income of about $6 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend $50 on food and $15 on the other necessary expenses. 

S. is requesting a loan of $700 to build a grocery store to start a new business. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her second loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner. 

S.'s husband appears in the photograph because she was not available.

loans.use: build a grocery store to start a new business

loans.name: Mayra Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora Mayra S. es socia del banco comunal San Pablo, vive en la comunidad de Rumiloma que  pertenece a la parroquia de Turi,  esta parroquia es nombrada como el balcón de la ciudad.
 
Doña Mayra tiene 27 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad, sus dos hijos  estudian en una escuela de la ciudad. Su esposo labora como albañil, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven en casa de unos familiares.

La Señora. Mayra se dedica a los quehaceres de su hogar y cría animales como cerdos, borregos y cuyes, los que vende en su comunidad. También siembra hortalizas  que son  para la venta y para su consumo.

Se encuentra en su sexto crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cerdos. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Sra. Mayra S. is a member of the San Pablo Communal Bank. She lives in the community of Rumiloma which is in the parish of Turi. This parish is also known as the “balcony” of the city.

Doña Mayra is 27 years old, married, and has two children (ages 9 and 5). Her children attend school in the city. Her husband works as a mason. They do not own a house, so they live at the home of relatives.

Sra. Mayra devotes herself to the household chores and raising animals such as pigs, sheep, and guinea pigs that she sells in her community. In addition, she grows crops to sell and for personal consumption.

Mayra is in her sixth loan cycle with the Communal Bank. The money from her loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs. Her goal is to have her own home.

loans.use: Purchase pigs

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita E. is from the village of Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 49 years old, married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Rosita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling daily use products such as canned goods and junk foods in the local community. Rosita has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Rosita joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Rosita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell such as beverages and canned goods. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell such as beverages and canned goods

location.town: Consolacion, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Sebeke Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe Sebeke, toutes mariées, ont en moyenne 43 ans, 3 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies dans le village de Welabougou, préfecture de Dioïla, Région de Koulikoro (deuxième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié. Elles font le                                                                                                                                     
Les femmes du groupe Sebeke sont à leur premier prêt solidaire avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                         
AMINATA D. compte acheter deux sacs de 100 Kg de céréales avec les producteurs du village et des villages environnants, hebdomadairement. Elle effectue ses ventes quotidiennement sur place à la maison et au marché, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 40 000F CFA qui sera utilisé pour les dépenses de ses enfants à savoir la santé, la nourriture et les frais scolaire et une partie pour son activité.
texts.en:
The members of the Sebeke group, all married women, are on the overage 43 years old, with three children. They all live in traditional extended families in the village of Welabougou, Diola pPefecture, Koulikoro Region (the second administrative region of Mali).

They know each other as relatives, neighbors, and friends. Their business is […text missing—Translator’s note].

The members of the Sebeke group are on their first solidarity laon with Soro Yiriwaso.

Aminata D. plans to use her loan to purchase two 100-kg bags of cereals from local farmers as well as from nearby villages, on a weekly basis. She sells daily out of her home and at the marketplace, for cash and on credit, to a customer base composed of men and women. She plans to achieve an average monthly income of 40,000 West African Frabcs, which will be used to cover healthcare, food, and school expenses for her children, with part of the money set aside for her business.

loans.use: To purchase cereals

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 49-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating a sari-sari store. She lives in  Negros Occidental. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her sari-sari store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. 

Gloria is borrowing PHP 10,000 to purchase more stock to sell. This will be her sixth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Gloria aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the Dungganon way.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store

loans.name: Salamba

texts.fr: Madame Salamba  S. est une femme  divorcée de 40 ans. Elle habite à Yoff. Elle a en charge 3enfant dont l’âge  varie entre 5 et 12 ans. Madame S. est couturière de profession, mais elle évolue aussi dans le domaine du commerce. Elle a une expérience  de plus de 5 ans dans son activité. Elle a choisi cette activité pour se procurer des revenus qui lui permettent de supporter les dépenses quotidiennes. Elle est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis novembre 2003. Elle a déjà soldés 5 prêts antérieurs au sein de l’U-IMCEC. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs. Avec son financement elle envisage d’acheter des tissus  avec lesquels elle va confectionner des habits , des robes et des pagnes qu’elle vend a crédit a ses  clients. Le but recherché  a travers ce financement est de maximiser son épargne et d’acquérir  une boutique.
texts.en:
Mrs. Salamba S. is a 40-year-old divorced woman. She lives in Yoff. She supports three children ranging in age from 5 to 12 years old. 

Mrs. S. is a seamstress by profession, but she is also a vendor. She has over five years of experience in this business. She chose this activity to generate the income necessary to cover daily expenses. 

She has been a member of the Yoff branch since November 2003. She has already repaid five previous loans with U-IMCEC, and is now requesting a loan of 500,000 francs. With this funding, she plans to buy fabrics to make suits, dresses and pagnes, which she will sell on credit to her customers. Her goal is to maximize her savings and open a shop.

loans.use: to buy fabrics

loans.name: Natercia Da Conceicao

texts.pt:
Natercia da Conceicao T. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique casada mãe de 3 filhos de idades entre 05 a 18 anos, os mais velhos continuam a estudar. Fez somente 9ª classe não continuou devido a falta de condicoes financeiras. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e não sustenta mais ninguém.

Saiu de Maputo para Boane com a sua familia quando concluiram a nova residencia, tem um negocio proprio ha mais de 5 anos. Não possui nenhum empregado e tem um rendimento mensal de 5.500.00mt por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e consegue poupar uma parte atravez de Xitique (sistema tradicional de poupanca rotativa).

Nunca teve empréstimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku através de suas amigas que são clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu quinto empréstimo na Hluvuku no valor de 25.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (refrescos, amendoim, acucar, caldo e outros) para aumentar a quantidade de seu stock. Os emprestimos anteriores foram de 8.300.00, 10.450.00, 12.000.00 e 15.000.00mt para o comercio.

Compromete se a pagar devidamente para poder aceder a outros créditos no futuro. Pretende solicitar novos empréstimos para ampliar a sua banca.
texts.en:
Natercia da Conceicao T. was born in Maputo City, Maputo Province in southern Mozambique. She is married and has three children, ages 5 to 18. The elder children are still in school. Natercia only finished ninth grade and did not continue due to financial difficulties. She lives in her own house with her family and does not support anyone else.

She left Maputo to move to Boane with her family when they finished building their new home. She has had her own business for more than five years. She has no employees and has a monthly income of 5,500 meticais, which she uses for household expenses. She is also able to save some money through Xitique (a traditional system of rotating savings).

She has never had loans from other banks. She learned about Hluvuku through friends who are customers of this institution. This is Natercia's fifth loan with Hluvuku, and she is asking for 25,000 meticais. She intends to buy products (soft drinks, peanuts, sugar, broth and other items) to increase the amount of stock she has. The previous loans were for 8,300 meticais, 10,450 meticais, 12,000 meticais and 15,000 meticais and were for the business.

She promises to make her payments on time so she can take out more loans in the future. She intends to ask for other loans to expand her sales stand.

loans.use: to buy products (soft drinks, peanuts, sugar, broth, etc.)

loans.name: Marita

texts.es: Marita, de 34 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en su propia casa  junto a su pareja José de 35 años y sus 02 queridos hijos Edson de 13 años y John de 08 años edad a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho ahínco Marita ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, cacao, café y plátano, productos que luego los lleva a vender hasta los centros de acopio situado en la ciudad de San Francisco, donde los vende al por mayor. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantenerse y sustentar los gastos de educación de sus queridos hijos; es por ello que pone todas sus ganas en sacar adelante sus cultivos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, ya que se siente muy feliz haciéndolo, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos desde la chacra hasta su comunidad que es un recorrido de 01 hora de caminata. En adelante desea comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en su anterior crédito y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre está al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará fungicidas y estiércol de animales para abonar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
34 year-old Marita is a very hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her partner, 35 year-old José, and her two beloved children: 13 year-old Edison and 8 year-old John, who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Marita has worked diligently on her land and made it very productive.  She grows cacao, coffee and bananas which she takes to the warehouse centers, in the city of San Francisco, to sell wholesale.  Her crops have provided her with the income she needs to support herself and cover the educational expenses of her beloved children.  This is why she puts all her efforts into making progress with her crops.

What Marita most enjoys about her work is caring for her crops since she feels happy doing this.  She has been in this business for 15 years and considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products from the farm to her community as it is a 1 hour walk.  In the future, she would like to buy more land so that she can increase her crops.  This is her fifth loan from MFP.  She was very punctual in repaying her previous loan and hopes to continue being punctual with this one.  Marita takes an active part in her community bank and is always aware of the agreements that her group has reached.  She will use the loan she has requested to buy fungicides and animal manure to fertilize her crops.

loans.use: to buy fungicides and manure for her crops

loans.name: Tanzila's Group

texts.en:
Tanzila is the treasurer of this group. She is 31 and married to a driver. Together with her husband she raises four sons. The older son helps his parents with the housework, the second is at school and the other sons are preschool age (under seven). Four years ago with the initial investment of 5000 soms, Tanzila bought two sheep and then resold them at the higher price after being fattened. Tanzila’s husband helps her with that activity. The family has just started building a new house, but they have a shortage of financial funds for purchasing construction materials. For this purpose Tanzila has applied for the loan. She hopes to finish the house construction in the near future.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials

loans.name: Mkuvumba

texts.en:
Mkuvumba is a divorced woman with six children, four of whom attend school while two have graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a coconut-selling business for the past four years, selling at the market to market shoppers and passers-by. She faces a major challenge of competition from other coconut sellers in the area. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000, she wants to purchase sacks of coconuts for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of coconuts for sale

loans.name: Johnstone

texts.en:
Johnstone is 33 years old, married, and has a daughter who is 1.5 years old. He has been running a computer and stationary store for 5 years. Johnstone sells computers, printers, stapling machines, printing papers and provides photocopy services. His clients include government offices, private companies, and individual customers. Johnstone plans to use the loan to order more cartridges and supplies for his business. 

Johnstone hopes to grow his business, become a successful entrepreneur, and have the ability to employ skilled laborers. In the future, he would like to be able to grow his business into a multinational company. Johnstone describes himself as honest, focused, and patient.

loans.use: order more cartridges and supplies for his business.

loans.name: Alpha

texts.en: Pictured above is Alpha, a small-scale businessman in the township of Kabala, in northern Sierra Leone.  Born in Kabala town, the 32 year-old husband and father of 2 children bakes and sells breads. He is also a motor-bike taxi driver. Alpha has been baking and selling breads for 10 years now. He has requested a loan of SLL 5,000,000 from SMT/Kiva lenders in order to buy baking flour to make more bread for sale.

loans.use: to buy baking flour in order to bake more bread for sale

loans.name: Bintihamisi

texts.en: Bintihamisi is a married woman with eight children, six boys and two girls, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. For the past two years, she has operated a food stall business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She does farming as her other source of income and faces a major challenge of seasonality. Bintihamisi dreams of expanding her business to improve her living standards. With the Kshs 28,724 she wants to purchase goats for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase goats for sale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata is 35 years old and married with four children, aged between 3 and 20. She runs a provisions and assorted drinks store in Lumley in the neighborhood of Freetown.

Fatmata has been in this business for six years and sells milk, biscuits and soft drinks at her store. She  owns a taxi from which she also earns income.

She says that her business is doing well. She also takes care of two of her relatives as well as their families.  Of her children, three are currently in secondary school and another in university. 

She requested this loan through BRAC Sierra Leone to purchase more provisions and assorted drinks. Fatmata says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her savings and educate her children. In the future, she would like to open a supermarket.

loans.use: To purchase more milk, biscuits and soft drinks.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 62 years old and married to Milcah. They are blessed with seven children. Currently only two depend on them. The rest are all grown up. He has been a dressmaker for the last three years, making a monthly profit of KES 7,000. He has been loaned KES 15,000, which he plans to use to purchase more clothes and materials for sale. 

With the anticipated profit, he plans to expand his business and educate the two remaining children to the college level. In the near future, he hopes to expand his business and build a decent house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes and materials to sell .

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace has been operating a general store and raising animals for sale for the last ten years. She is a 52 year-old widow with two children.

She was introduced to KADET by a friend who is also a KADET client. She intends to use the loan amount to add stock in her shop and to increase her livestock, like cows and sheep.  In the future, Grace hopes to expand her business and open a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To add stock to her shop and to increase livestock, like cows and sheep

loans.name: Isis Rosmeri

texts.es: Isis Rosmeri de 30 años de edad, reside en casa familiar junto a su padre de 65 años y su pequeño hijo de 7 años. Ella se dedica a la venta de perfumería y variedad de ropa usada. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su hogar de habitación. Gracias a su carisma muchas personas la prefieren y demandan los productos que Isis vende. Hasta el momento el negocio es rentable y es su principal fuente de ingresos.  Ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL con el fin de comprar variedad de perfumería y ropa usada (pantalones, faldas, blusas, short, etc.), para atraer a más clientes que le permitan aumentar su nivel de ventas y de ingresos. Espera y confía en Dios que de esta manera su situación actual mejorará y logrará tener acceso a una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Isis Rosmeri is 30 years old.  She lives in her family home with her 65 year old father and her little 7 year old son.  She sells perfume as well as a variety of used clothing.  Her business is located in her home.  Thanks to her charisma, many people prefer her and request the products Isis sells.  Her business is her main source of income and so far, it is profitable.  She has decided to request this loan from INTEGRAL to buy a variety of perfume and used clothing (trousers, skirts, blouses, shorts, etc.) in order to attract more customers, which will allow her to increase her sales and income. She trusts in God and hopes that, in this way, her present situation will improve and she will have access to a better quality of

loans.use: to buy a variety of perfume and used clothing (trousers, skirts, blouses, and shorts).

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline is 42 years old and has three children between the ages of three and thirteen. The eldest two children are in school. Jacqueline's husband is a technician at RwandaTech. 
Jacqueline rents out traditional wedding clothes. She has been running this business for the last two years. She needs a loan to buy more traditional clothes for rental. Jacqueline will use the profits to continue to expand her business and begin selling decorations for weddings and events.

loans.use: to purchase traditional wedding clothes to rent out at her store.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 39 years old and a married woman with five children. One of her children is in school. She has a business of selling beer in the Hai Mahad branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for five years.

Lucy requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She says that she will use the profits generated from this loan to pay the school fees of her child.

loans.use: to purchase beer for sale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is 47-years-old, and a single mother of a grown up children. She sells cereals and has been in the business for the past 10 years.

This is her third loan term from KADET LTD. She paid her previous loans successfully. She will use the loan amount to purchase more cereals for resale. 

She will use the anticipated profits to build rental houses. Her dream is to own many rental houses and start farming.

loans.use: to buy more cereals for sale.

loans.name: Sos

texts.en:
Mrs. Sos is a good housewife and a good mother who always educates and takes care of her children at home. She is married to Mr. Math who works as a construction foreman. Her main income is from her husband who yields a profit of $8 per day from his business. Two of her children are now working; her daughter is a garment factory worker and her son is a construction worker in the field with his father. Even though Mrs. Sos doesn’t work outside the home or earn any income for her family, she often helps give good suggestions to her husband in order to improve their standard of living. 

Sometimes there is no work to do at the construction field, so Mrs. Sos thinks that her husband should use that time to do other work that can produce money. She wants to buy a tuk-tuk (three-wheeler vehicle) for her husband so he can start providing service for more profit when he is free. Thus, Mrs. Sos is asking for a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a tuk-tuk to support her husband’s new business. In the future, she plans to fix her old house and save some money for the future growth and enlargement of her family’s business.

loans.use: to purchase a tuk-tuk (three-wheeler vehicle) to support her husband’s new business.

loans.name: G.s. Paso De Dios Group

texts.es: La señora Martina Del Rosario es tiene su negocio que consiste en la venta de ropa tanto nueva como usada de manera ambulante principalmente por encargos y últimamente también vende cosméticos. Su mayor obstáculo ha sido siempre la falta de recursos para poder engrandecer el negocio. El crédito es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, trajes, vestidos y ropa para niños. Desea en un futuro comprar un tramo en el mercado para ofertar sus bienes. La señora Marbelly tiene 2 hijos menores de edad de 6 y 8 años, su esposo trabaja como vendedor de frutas y verduras. Ella solicito este crédito para la compra de mangos, bananos, entre otros. Como vende de manera ambulante aduce no tener mucha competencia. Desea en el futuro abrir una nueva ruta de ventas de sus productos. Desea continuar invirtiendo en el negocio
texts.en:
Martina Del Rosario has a business selling pre-ordered new and used clothes on foot and recently cosmetics as well. Her main obstacle has always been the lack of resources to expand her business. The loan is to buy pants, blouses, skirts, suits, dresses, and children’s wear. In the future she would like to buy a space in the market to sell her goods. 

Marbelly has two young children aged 6 and 8. Her husband is a fruit and vegetable vendor. She is asking for a loan to buy mangos, banana, and other produce. Since she sells on-foot she says she doesn’t have much competition. In the future she wants to open a new sales route for her products. She would like to continue investing in the business.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, skirts, suite, dresses, and children's clothing.

loans.name: Justus

texts.en: Justus is a 53-year-old man who has operated a general store for four years. Previously, he was employed as a driver. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has gained a lot of knowledge about business management skills, helping him to grow his business. His desire is to establish a wholesale business. He is requesting a loan of 100,000 Kenyan shillings to buy sugar, rice, and maize flour.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, and rice.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 42-years-old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Annabelle is providing motorcycle, or habal-habal, services with her husband as the driver. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy tools and pay for the gasoline. 

Annabelle has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Annabelle hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and pay for the gasoline.

loans.name: Santos Esther

texts.es:
La señora Santos Esther tiene 30 años de edad,  vive en la comunidad de Palo Herrado, ahi vive con sus hijos y esposo, quien es comerciante y juntos trabajan duro para sacar adelante a sus hijos.
Santos Esther se dedica a la produccion y venta de tortillas, tiene 3 años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, sus clientes son sus vecinos y otras personas que le piden por encargo.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de maiz, leña, cal y agua para tener una mayor produccion de tortillas.
texts.en:
Santos Esther is 30 years old. She lives in the Palo Herrado community with her children and her husband, a retailer, and they both work hard to provide for their children.

Santos Esther engages in producing and selling tortillas. She has been engaged in this activity for 3 years, and her customers are mainly her neighbors and people who place orders with her.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy maize, firewood, lime and water in order to improve her tortillas production.

loans.use: to purchase corn, firewood, lime and water.

loans.name: Mindalina

texts.en:
Mindalina is 44 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell for her sari-sari (variety) store.

Mindalina has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for two years and also earns an income from retailing gasoline.

Mindalina aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell for her sari-sari (variety) store.

loans.name: Yehime 3 Group

texts.fr: Le groupement YEHIME 3 est composé de onze personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. La représentante de ce groupement, du nom de Virginie est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé. Virginie n’a jamais fréquenté l’école. Virginie est âgée de 50 ans et est mariée à un certain Yaovi. Le couple a cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés et deux restent à leur charge. Virginie et son mari vivent ensemble avec leurs deux enfants à charge et assurent ensemble les diverses charges de la famille. Pour contribuer aux divers besoins de sa famille, Virginie vend depuis quinze ans, du riz et des condiments à son domicile. Virginie s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans le but de renforcer leur activité et de mieux satisfaire leur clientèle, Virginie et les autres membres du groupement YEHIME 3 sollicitent un premier crédit auprès de ALIDé. Leur ambition est d’accroître le niveau de leur activité.
texts.en: YEHIME 3 is a group composed of 11 people who all live in the same neighborhood. The group representative, Virginie, is the one raising her hand on the picture. In order to strenghten their business and better meet the needs of their customers, this group is seeking financial support from ALIDÉ for the first time. Virginie never went to school. She is 50 ans and is married to a man named Yaovi. They have five children. Some of them go to school. Two are still their dependents. Virginie and her husband live with their dependent children. They both take care of the family financially. In order to contribute to family-related expenses, Virginie has been selling rice and condiments from home for 15 years. She buys those items in a market in Benin. In order to strengthen their business and better meet the needs of their customers, Virginie and the other members of YEHIME 3 are applying for this first loan from ALIDÉ. Their ambition is to increase their business.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice and condiments.

loans.name: Joram

texts.en: Joram is 29 years old, married and has two children, aged 2 and 4. He sells plates, slippers and polythene papers to earn a living. He has been in the business for 3 years and he describes his business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Joram has been able to save his income. He hopes to be financially stable in the future. He has applied for 25,000 Kenya Shillings to buy plates, polythene papers and slippers to sell.

loans.use: to buy plates, polythene papers and slippers to sell.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre cabeza de hogar de sus 3 hijos a quienes su madre abandonó hace algún tiempo, y debido a esto Manuel tiene la obligación de generar los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Anteriormente trabajaba como maestro de construcción, pero debido a las pocas oportunidades laborales que encontraba se vio en la obligación de buscar otra fuente de ingresos. Fue así como montó una cafetería en la cual no lleva más de 1 mes trabajando, y debido a que la montó con muy bajo capital, Manuel busca que un préstamo le permita comprar productos para surtir su cafetería y así poder ofrecer un buen servicio a sus clientes.
De esta manera podrá salir con este negocio adelante que le ha generado los ingresos para su hogar en el último mes. Además, espera que con mayores ingresos sus dificultades económicas mejores y así sus 3 hijos tengan la oportunidad de acceder a una mejor calidad de vida y mayores oportunidades económicas para progresar.
texts.en:
Manuel is a gentleman who is the head of his household, which includes his three children.  Their mother abandoned them some time ago, so he was obligated to earn enough money to maintain the household expenses.  Manuel previously worked as a master builder, but since there were few job opportunities, he decided to look for another source of income.  He established a cafeteria in less than a month since very little capital was required.  

Manuel is seeking a loan in order to buy products to stock his cafeteria, which will help him provide good service to his customers.  In this manner, his business can move forward and generate household income, just as it did last month.  He hopes that more income will improve his difficult financial situation and provide his three children with a better quality of life and better opportunities to make progress.

loans.use: to buy inventory for his cafeteria.

loans.name: Venceremos Group

texts.es: Es un grupo formado por cuatro socias emprendedoras una de ellas es Erica que vende cosméticos de la Avon desde hace tres años, el crédito lo solicita para la compra de cosméticos de la Avon como bodis, crema para el cuerpo, crema para las manos, lociones, perfumen etc. Jessica vende chinelas, Digna vende comida y Maricela vende sandalias de cueros hechas en Masaya.
texts.en: This group is made up of four members. One of them is Erica; she has sold Avon makeup for some 3 years. The loan will be used to buy Avon makeup like body spray, body lotion, hand cream, lotions, perfumes, etc. Jessica sells slippers, Digna sells food and Maricela sells leather sandals made in Masaya.

loans.use: buy Avon makeup like body lotion, hand cream, lotions, perfumes, etc.

loans.name: Rosaura

texts.en:
Rosaura is 54 years old and is a happy married woman. She lives in the municipality of Yarumal with her husband and 3 children, 2 girls and 1 boy. They are the motor that makes Rosaura moves and work hard. She’s the owner of a miscellaneous where she sells different kind of products like clothes.

She’s a responsible and really honest woman that wants to improve her business, and loves working as an independent. She wants to increase her sales, and with those, her profits, and the most important thing, to make her business last in time. She’s asking for a loan so she can buy more inputs, especially toys for this Christmas season.

Rosaura dreams with paying for some professional education for her children so they can succeed in life. Help this amazing woman to accomplish all her dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: buy more inputs, especially toys for this Christmas season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Mary wants to buy a water tank

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en:
Mutabar is 35 years old. She is married and has two sons. Her family was never rich and Mutabar could not get a good education and as a result could not get a well-paid job. Her husband was the only bread-winner but several years ago he lost his job.

Mutabar had a small table by her house where she sold fried sunflower seeds. She bought raw seeds, fried them and sold them by her house. When she started receiving loans she started at $15. Over time she increased the loan amount and her next loan will be $100. By using her next loan she would like to add other small goods in her sales, like matches, candy and others.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr:
Mrs B. Akouvi was born in 1978 in Tsévié. Married and mother of one child, her husband is a woodworker and has been meeting the needs of the family until his business began to fail. To take up the slack, Mrs. Akouvi has already benefited from a loan to help her relaunch her little general food store. She has already paid back this loan. With an eye to strengthening her business and making it more profitable, she is asking for another loan of $650 to stock up on sugar, milk, canned goods and other products sought after by her clients. She will be able to meet the demands of her family.

Translated from French by Susan Bell, Kiva Volunteer.

Madame B. Akouvi est née en 1978 à Tsévié. Mariée et mère d’un enfant, son mari est menuisier et s’occupe tout seul de la famille jusqu’au jour où les activités ne marche plus. Pour prendre la relève, Madame bénéficia d’un crédit pour relancer son petit commerce d’alimentation générale, crédit qui a été déjà remboursé. Afin de renforcer son activité et mieux la rentabiliser, elle sollicite un crédit de $650 pour s’approvisionner en sucre, lait boîte de conserve et autres produits recherchés par sa clientèle. Elle pourra faire face aux charges du foyer.

loans.use: Stock up on sugar, milk, canned goods and other products

loans.name: Akoélé

texts.fr:
Akoélé K. was born in Yovovi-Kondji. She is 35, the mother of three and head of her household since her husband has taken a second wife and no longer cares for her or her children. She supports herself and her children by making manioc flour, an activity she has pursued for 10 years. Her production and income, however, are limited by insufficient capital. At this time she is asking for a loan of $800 to buy manioc in bulk allowing her to increase her family's standard of living.

Translated by a Kiva volunteer.

Mère de trois (3) enfants, Madame K. Akoélé est née à Yovovi-Kondji. A 35 ans, elle est devenu ce qu’il est convenu d’appeler « chef de famille » de par sa bravoure à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille. Son mari ayant épousé une seconde femme, ne s’occupe plus d’elle et de ses enfants. L’avenir de ces derniers tient beaucoup à cœur à Madame K. Akoélé qui s’est adonnée totalement à la transformation de manioc en gari ; activité qu’elle exerce depuis 10 ans. Mais le manque de moyen financier limite sa production et donc ses revenus. Aujourd’hui elle sollicite un crédit de $800 afin d’acheter en grande quantité le manioc. Ceci l’emmènera à satisfaire tous les clients et à dégager beaucoup de revenus susceptibles de relever le niveau de vie de sa famille.

loans.use: Achat de manioc pour sa transformation en farine

loans.name: Gulbadji

texts.en: Gulbadji, 49 is a mother of 2 children. She lives in Khacmaz region. She has been selling food stuff for 4 years.  She is requesting a loan of $775 to buy food stuff for improving her business.

loans.use: To buy foodstuff

loans.name: Ni Komang Mariani

texts.id:
Ni Komang Mariani has two children, one currently in university that forces Mariani to work more for the sake of to support her child’s aspiration. Mariani wish that when her child succeeds it would alter their life. For that Mariani chose pig farming as it is very suitable to be carried out in the village. With the initial funding of Rp. 2.500.000 (USD270), - Mariani rear 2 mother pigs and 5 piglets for growth. Profit from each piglet, after paying for feed is Rp. 80.000 (USD8.50). This profit will be used to pay for the child’s education. Seeing her development Mariani need additional funding which will be used to purchase mother pig thus generating larger profit as each month Mariani is able to harvest and sell the pigs.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Komang Mariani memiliki dua orang anaknya, salah satunya kini sedang duduk dibangku kuliah yang mengharuskan Mariani harus bekerja lebih keras lagi demi mendukung cita –cita anaknya. Mariani sangat ingin sekali melihat anaknya berhasil dan nantinya bisa merubah kehidupan mereka. Untuk itu Mariani memilih usaha beternak karena usaha inilah yang paling cocok dijalankan di daerah pedesaan. Dengan modal awal Rp. 2.500.000,- Mariani memelihara 2 ekor induk dan 5 babi penggemukan. Keuntungan yang diperoleh perekor mencapai Rp. 80.000,- setelah dikurangi biaya pakan. Dari keuntungan inilah yang nantinya dipakai untuk biaya sekolah anaknya.Sekarang melihat perkembangan dari usahanya Mariani membutuhkan tambahan modal yang akan dipergunakan untuk membeli induk babi agar mendatangkan keuntungan yang lebih besar dan diupayakan agar setiap bulan Mariani bisa panen dan menjual babinya

loans.use: Purchase mother pig (Membeli induk babi)

loans.name: Celestina

texts.es:
Mrs. Celestine belongs to the communal bank “La Marginal II”, she resides in the San Martin Region, province of San Martin, district of La Banda de Shilcayo. Her home and business are located on the main road of Fernando Belaúnde Terry (Route South) Km 3.5 and she dedicates herself to the production of Almidón (yucca flour) for wholesale.

Her husband and children help with the business and she also employs three other people. With the Manuela Ramos loans she’s been able to increase production as there was high demand for her product but lack of capital.

With the loan for $525.00, which she’ll pay back in 4 months, she’ll buy yucca in quantities of 50 kilos from the farms of her suppliers; she’ll also rent lands to plant yucca in order to supply all her clients and containers to process the product.

Mrs. Celesting is 39 years old and has 6 children, 4 of which live with her. She feels satisfied with the work she does and by expanding her business, feels good about being able to offer other women like her employment. Her wish is to see them also become successful business women.

Translated from Spanish by Lizella West, Kiva volunteer.

La señora Celestina pertenece al Banco Comunal “La Marginal II”, vive en la Región San Martín, provincia de San Martín, distrito de La Banda de Shilcayo. Su domicilio y negocio están ubicados en la Carretera Fernando Belaúnde Terry (Marginal Sur) Km. 3.5 y se dedica a la producción de Almidón (harina de yuca) al por mayor.

Tiene el apoyo de su esposo, los hijos y asimismo tiene la posibilidad de dar empleo a tres personas más. Con el apoyo de los préstamos de Manuela Ramos ha podido ampliar su mercado ya que tenía demanda pero por falta de capital no podía atenderlos.

Con el préstamo de S/. 1,500.00, el cual pagará en 4 meses, comprará yuca en quintales (50 kilos) en las chacras de sus proveedores, asimismo alquiló terrenos para la siembra de la yuca para abastecer a toda su clientela y envases (bandejas) para el proceso de este producto.

La señora Celestina tiene 39 años de edad, seis hijos de los cuales cuatro viven con ella. En la actualidad se siente satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza y al incrementar su negocio le satisface poder dar trabajo a otras mujeres como ella y su deseo es que ellas también sean comerciantes exitosas.

loans.use: To buy yucca and rent lands for planting.  To purchase containers.

location.town: La Banda de Shilcayo - San Martín

loans.name: Norma Luz

texts.es:
Señora Norma is a member of the communal bank called 'Nuevo Eden' which is located in the district of Yarina Cocha in Ucayali. She's 28 years old. She has 4 children who still depend on her financially. She's married and her husband is a painter. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to open up a small grocery store.

She runs her grocery store from her home. She gets up each morning about 6:00 am to prepare breakfast for her family while she runs her store at the same time.

With this loan, which she will repay within 5 months, she will purchase rice, sugar, eggs, milk, etc.

Norma feels that her finances are very good since she's able to manage her own business and she's able to help with the schooling for her children. She's very thankful to Manuela Ramos for all her support.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Norma pertenece al banco comunal Nuevo Edén, ubicado en Pasaje Francisco del Águila Mz D Lt 3, distrito de Yarina Cocha, departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años, es madre de 4 hijos, todos menores de edad, es casada y su esposo es pintor. Con el primer préstamo de S/. 300 que recibió de Manuela Ramos decide invertir en una pequeña bodega. En la actualidad cuenta con una bodega en su hogar. A diario se levanta a las 6 a.m. para preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y de su esposo y simultáneamente atiende en la bodega .. Con el préstamo de S/. 1,700, el cual pagará en 5 meses, invertirá en la compra de 1 saco de arroz, 1 saco de azúcar, 4 cajas de huevos, 1 caja de leche, etc. Norma se siente estable económicamente porque puede manejar su propio negocio y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos y está muy agradecida al apoyo que le brinda Manuela Ramos.

loans.use: To purchase basic food supplies such as rice, sugar, eggs, milk, etc.

loans.name: Komlan Faustin

texts.fr:
Mr. A. Komlan Faustin was born on May 21, 1963 in Lome. He is handicapped, a father of one child and takes care of another person. Due to a lack of means, he had to give up his training in computer science and became a shoemaker. Having received his diploma after his training, he is now asking for a loan in order to open a workshop and to buy supplies and materials so that he can showcase his knowledge to his customers. A well-organized man, he would like to establish a more consistent credit in order to build other commercial activities. His dynamism and skill are his best assets to ensure the success of this project.

Translated from French by Ivana Kostic, Kiva translator

Monsieur A. Komlan Faustin est né le 21 Mai 1963 à Lomé père d'un (1) enfant et a une personne en charge et handicapé. Par manque de moyen, il abandonne sa formation en informatique et apprend la cordonnerie. Ayant reçu son diplôme après sa formation, il sollicite un crédit afin d'ouvrir un atelier et acquérir des fournitures et matériels de cordonnerie pour faire ressortir son savoir faire à sa clientèle. Bien organisé, il pense avoir plus tard un crédit plus consistant pour associer à la cordonnerie d'autres initiatives du genre commercial. Son dynamisme et son habileté constituent autant d'atouts pour le succès de son projet.

loans.use: Opening a shoemaking workshop and purchase of materials

loans.name: Rosa Edy

texts.en:
Her business is located at the outsides of a school where the majority of her clients are children. The business is family run, and all of her siblings take part in commercial activities. They inherited it from their mother. The business was started with ten dollars, and that has been multiplying to this day. Her family is comprised of two people, her daughter and her husband. Her daughter is in grade school, which makes it hard for her to help her family financially. Her husband helps with food expenses, but not for education and other family expenses. The endorsement of Mrs. Echerria would help her greatly by allowing her to be able to get ahead, especially in ways which the employment of her husband has lacked. What she is looking for in this financing is the ability to sell a broader range of products to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva volunteer

Su negocio esta ubicado alas afueras de una escuela por lo que en su mayoría sus clientes son los niños que vienen a la misma, el negocio es algo de familia ya que todos sus hermanos se han dedicado a actividades de comercio, y pues fue su madre de quien lo heredaron , su negocio lo inicio con diez dolares lo cual a multiplicado hasta la fecha , su grupo familiar lo componen dos personas una hija y su compañero de vida, su hija actualmente se encuentra en etapa escolar lo cual le dificulta el poder tener un empleo y a la misma vez el poder dar la atención necesaria , no asi en el caso del negocio, su compañero da un aporte lo cual ayuda para la alimentación pero no para educación y otros gastos del grupo familiar , el aporte de la señora Echerria le a ayudado en gran manera para poder salir adelante incluso en periodos en los cuales el empleo de su esposo a faltado, lo que busca con su financiamiento es el poder surtir mas con artículos que buscan los niños que son sus clientes.

loans.use: Buy candies and cloths that are the most distributed products in the region.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is a trader who sells cosmetics and clothing. She is married and has 2 children. Business is doing very well and she plans to increase sales.

She is asking for $525 to buy more goods to sell.

loans.use: To buy more cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Sotheany

texts.en:
Mrs. Sotheany U., 23, and her husband Mr. Sam-At Sok were married in 2005. They have one daughter. The couple lives with Sotheany’s parents on an Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Sotheany has been a silk weaver for eight years. It’s a skill she learned from her parents. She sells her finished products to the middle man in the village, who will take them to sell in Phnom Penh. Her husband is a silk weaver as well, and now he is creating another business - planting mushrooms to sell. Mushrooms are a very important staple vegetable in Cambodian food.

So, Sotheany is requesting a loan of $700 to build a room for her husband for planting mushrooms.

loans.use: To build a room for planting mushrooms

loans.name: Yrene Del Pilar

texts.en:
Yrene belongs to the María Milagrosa Village Bank and lives in Villa María del Triunfo in Lima with her husband. She has 3 children, 27, 29 and 31 years old who are married and who have children as well.

Yrene has a microenterprise of materials for furniture, chair and bench tapestries. Until last year, her husband was managing the business because she dedicated herself to selling cakes. But from this year, she’s in charge of the entire business.

Yrene is soliciting a 3 000 soles loan so as to purchase tapestry materials such as leather, foam rubber, cotton, and cloth to stock in her store.

Her microenterprise has helped her for her sons’ education and also helped her son-in-law to buy a car, given that he had had the car he was using as a taxi stolen.

Now, Yrene wants to help her grandchildren, she has lots of plans in mind, one of them is to purchase a car to make her grandchild work, it’s a great challenge but she is sure he’ll succeed.

loans.use: Yrene is asking for a 3 000 soles loan so as to purchase tapestry materials such as leather, foam rubber, cotton, and cloth to stock in her store.

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr:
Born in 1981 in Gamé (P/Zio), Mrs. Abra D. is married and supports two people. Her main occupation is growing corn. She is able to contribute to her household with her income. She is seeking a loan that will allow her to expand her cultivatable land and buy fertilizer to enrich the soil.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer.

Née en 1981 à Gamé (P/Zio), Madame D. Abra est mariée et a à sa charge deux (2) personnes. Son activité principale est la culture de maïs. Avec son revenu, elle arrive à contribuer aux charges du foyer. Elle sollicite un crédit qui va lui permettre d’augmenter sa surface cultivable et acheter des engrais pour rendre le sol plus fertile.

loans.use: To expand cultivatable land

loans.name: Les Lingueres De Falokh Serre Group

texts.fr:
Working together as a group named « Les Lingueres », these women, each whom is married with children, have started a business selling food products (rice, grains, milk, soap, peanut butter) to earn a living and to free themselves from the financial authority of their husbands. For two years they have been working with UIMCEC thanks to the various loans that they have been granted. The loans they obtain help strengthen the business income that they each earn by allowing them to purchase increased amounts of product to sell.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva volunteer.

Réunues au sein d'un groupement dénommé les lingueres ,ces femmes toute mariée et mére de plusieurs enfants ont initié des activités de vente de produits alimentaires (riz ,céréales ,lait,savon, pattes d 'arachide ) pour gagner leur vie et s'affrachire financierement de la tutelle de leur mari.Pendant deux (02); elles sont accompagnées par l ' UIMCEC grace à differents prets qui leur sont octroyer.Les prets obtenus servent à renforcer le fonds de commerce de chacune d'elle par l "achat de quantités plus importante de marchandises.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Penda

texts.fr: Penda S. est une femme veuve agée de trente deux ans.elle habite à la cité lamy et fait du commerce de tissus, draps etc depuis cinq ans
texts.en:
Penda S. is a 32-year-old widow. She lives in Cité Lamy and has been doing commerce in fabrics, sheets, etc. for five years.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vente de draps

loans.name: Semeni

texts.en: Semeni has been selling sambusa in Zanzibar for eight years. Sambusa are a snack commonly sold in Tanzania. They consist of a fried outer shell with a meat or vegetable filling. Each one is sold for between $0.10 and $0.15. Semeni is 31 years old, married, and has three children between the ages of 4 and 12. She works daily from 7:00am to 2:00pm and is able to earn a monthly profit of approximately $85. She is hoping that this loan allows her to increase her profit and expand her business.

loans.use: Semeni would like to buy more ingredients to prepare sambusas to sell.

loans.name: Nile Lending Group

texts.en: Monica L. is a 36-year-old widow raising six children, who are all in school except for the eldest who recently graduated.     She has owned and managed a restaurant at a nearby market for 12 years, serving local food 12 hours each day, every day, to about 20 patrons at a time.  Since recieving her first microcredit loan, Monica has been able to purchase non-perishable items in bulk and thereby save time, money, and interest on her credit balance.  In order to further increase the efficiency of her restaurant and earn more profit, which will be used to continue educating her children, Monica is requesting a loan of $2425.  She will use the loan to purchase a refrigerator so that she can offer cold drinks, and also to buy sugar, rice, beans, maize flour, sauces, chicken, fish and other ingredients for her menu.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and non-perishable ingredients in bulk.

loans.name: Tofiq

texts.en:
At 44 years of age, Tofiq A. is married and lives with his wife, daughter and pensioned parents. His principal work is the buying and selling of cattle, a business requiring costly travel as he goes to remote areas where these animals cost less. While the enterprise is very profitable, Tofiq’s lack of capital makes his income insignificant, and living conditions remain difficult in his household.

In order to strengthen his business, Tofiq is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy more cattle to expand his business. This will allow him to effectively meet the needs of his household.

loans.use: To purchase four calves.

loans.name: Tomas

texts.es:
Tomas  se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche lo comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche). Además trabaja como agricultor en la producción de papa.
 
Vive. en la comunidad Chojasivi de la Provincia Loa Andes del departamento de La Paz ubicado  a cuatro horas de la ciudad de La Paz.

Vive junto a su esposa quien le colabora en los quehaceres del ganado y su hogar que constya de 5 hijos. 
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de una vaca lechera y así incrementar  la producción de leche, por lo tanto sus ingresos.
 
Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Tomas makes a living raising dairy cattle and sells the milk production to PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadora de Leche). He also works as a farmer growing potatoes. He lives in the community of Chojasivi of the province of Los Andes of the department of La Paz located four hours for the city of La Paz. He lives with his wife who helps with the care of the cattle and his home which includes 5 children. The loan will be used to purchase a dairy cow which will increase the production and therefore increase his income. This is the first loan with Impro. The credit evaluation qualifies him to receive this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Alima

texts.en: Alima A. sells bags of rice and beans in Bodija market. This market is one of the largest markets in Ibadan, Nigeria. She sells her bags of beans and rice wholesale and retail to her customers. She needs the loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more bags of rice and beans to sell. She is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Alidjon

texts.ru: Зиеев Алиджон житель Вхдата. Женат и имеет четверых детей. Возраст 48 лет. Занимается бизнесом в сфере животноводства.Имеет небольшое хозяйство , где разводит крупно-рогатый скот. Обратился за кредитом , чтобы получить возможность купить породистого бычка. Использовать его он хочет в целях разводить породистое потомство. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 6 месяцев.Его дело приносит неплохие доходы. Но кроме него в семье работает его дочь. Она торгует на рынке овощами и фруктами.
texts.en:
Alidjon Z. lives in Vahdat. He is 48 years old, married and has four children. His business is animal husbandry. He has a small farm where he raises cattle. His business is profitable. His daughter also works outside the home. She sells vegetables and fruits at a market. Alidjon wants to obtain this loan in order to purchase a purebred bull. He wants to use the bull to breed and raise purebred offspring. Alidjon will be able to repay the loan within 6 months.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a purebred bull

loans.name: Sichat

texts.en:
Mrs. Sichat Kam is 37 years old. She is single and lives with her brother and an old father on Island in the Mekong River, about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh, the capital city of Cambodia.

Sichat has been a silk weaver for twenty years. She sells her finished products to the middleman in the village, who then takes it to sell at market in Phnom Penh. Her brother raises cows. Sichat wants to purchase silk materials to continue her weaving business in order to earn income to support her family. She doesn’t have enough capital, so she is requesting a loan of $150 to use for this purpose.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: El señor Wilfredo Solís Pérez tiene la edad de 55 años,  habita en el barrio Esquípula, junto a su esposa doña Martha la cual trabaja como comerciante en el mercado, para apoyarle con los gastos del hogar, ellos tiene  dos hijos una de 29 años ya es casada y otra de 18 años que actualmente estudia, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de vida ya que ellos se han sacrificado mucho para poder salir hacia delante con sus cultivos , don William se dedica a la agricultura desde hace cinco años , pero a la vez trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una casa privada tres veces por semana desde hace ocho años , donde el trabaja casi son vecinos . La mayor dificultad que se le ha presentado durante su cultivo es la falta de financiamiento y por ello que el cultivo esta un poco maltratado, pero con la ayuda técnica de nuestro agrónomo puede salir hacia delante. El financiamiento es para la compra de insumos y fertilizantes.
texts.en:
Señor Wilfredo Solís is 55 years old. He lives in the neighbourhood Esquípula, along with his wife Doña Martha who works as a commercial woman in the market in order to help with the expenses of the household. They have two children, a daughter of 29 years and another daughter of 18 years who is currently studying. The plans of the family are to better their conditions of life as they have already sacrificed a lot to move ahead with their cultivations. Don Wilfredo has been dedicated to agriculture for the past 5 years, but at times he works as a security guard in a private house three times per week, and has done so for the past 8 years, where he works almost with his neighbours. The biggest difficulty that has presented itself during their cultivation is the lack of financing, and because of this the farm is a little rundown, but with the technical help of our agronomist it will be able to improve. The financing is for the purchase of materials and fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy farming materials

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Roberto is 33 years old and lives in the village of San Juan, Quirino, Isabela with his wife Vilma and their only child April Grace. Their daughter is now in the primary level of education. Robert supports his family through his furniture-making business. He has been in this enterprise for more than two years. He earns a monthly income of PHP 10,000, and the income is being used as rolling capital and in providing for the immediate needs of his family and educational needs of his child.
 
Roberto requests an initial loan of PHP 4,000 that will serve as additional capital for his business. He will use the loan to purchase new materials needed in making furniture. He wants his business to progress so that he can meet the growing needs of his family. He is thankful that his family is always in good health. He is also starting to save some of his income for future needs. He hopes that someday his daughter will finish her college education.

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a 21 year old mother of two children, ages 6 years and 5 months. She sells vegetables that she purchases from the matatu stage (bus stop) in town. She lives near the Manyata slum and sells her goods in the Kibuye market, Kisumu's largest open-air market. She's married to a telephone repair man. She is asking for 15,000 KSH to expand her business. She says that her main challenges are a lack of purchasing power, inadequate finance, and lack of transportation means.

Beatrice recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutri Flour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: To buy stock of vegetables.

loans.name: Mamir

texts.en:
Mamir is a responsible father and loving son. From the time he was a boy, he learned the honorable work of raising livestock, activities which were passed down from his parents and which today bring him satisfaction. Thanks to his valuable knowledge of the livestock trade, he has been able to obtain good results from his sales. This enterprising gentleman’s wish is to invest more capital in young animals. Mamir hopes to continue his dedication to his work, believing that by improving his stock and feed, his cattle will bring better prices. For this reason, he is turning to you for the support that would permit him to continue developing his business.   
 
More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Jovie

texts.en:
Jovie is engaged in vending chicharon (fried pork skin) in her village. She is requesting a loan of PHP 4,000 to be able to have additional capital to increase her daily income. She has been in the business for twenty years and she hopes that it will become progressive so that her income will increase.

Through the aid of a motorcycle, she is able to deliver her chicharon to some stores in their village and sometimes to nearby villages. According to Jovie, she has to perform her obligation as a good mother to her children by providing them with support for their education so that they have the opportunity for a better future. 

Jovie is 35 years old and is married to Jofel A.. They are living in Barangay San manue,l Naguilian, Isabela and they are blessed with four children. Through the help of her brother-in-law they were able to start their business. She hopes that someday, with the help of the loan, the business will expand and will help increase her family’s standard of living.

loans.use: To use as business capital

loans.name: Lauben

texts.en: Mr. T. Lauben is a businessman with a studio with photographs and albums. He is using the loan for purchasing more photo frames and other studio items for his shop. He aspires to own a large studio and also hopes to start a video coverage business and create new opportunities. He has been operating the business for four years. He has four children, three schooling and one still at home.

loans.use: To purchase more photo frames and other studio items for his shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand stock and sell more goods

loans.name: Mirtha Victoria

texts.es:
Mirtha es socia del Banco Comunal Buena Suerte.
